title: Acquisition Liaison
description: Job Summary As affiliates of the PCI Federal Services group of companies, PCI Government Services LLC has a passion for our team members and their personal mission for success. We offer excellent insurance, leave and developmental benefits along with some flexibility for remote work opportunities. Come join our organization and be part of an exciting team supporting our Federal, DoD and Private Sector customers! We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Acquisition Business Analyst to join our team. As an Acquisition Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in supporting our acquisition activities by conducting thorough analyses of acquisition requirement packages. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in business analysis, and financial analysis, coupled with excellent problem-solving and communication skills. Duties and Responsibilities Collaborate with the acquisition team to gather requirements, objectives, and priorities for potential acquisitions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify integration requirements, assess operational impact, and develop implementation plans for successful acquisition. Provide insights and recommendations to senior management. Monitor and track the progress of ongoing acquisitions, ensuring adherence to timelines, objectives, and key performance indicators (KPIs). Stay up-to-date with industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to mergers and acquisitions. Qualifications 8 years’ experience Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field. Strong financial analysis skills, including financial modeling, valuation techniques, and cost-benefit analysis. Proficiency in using financial software and tools, such as Excel, financial databases, and statistical analysis software. Solid understanding of financial statements, financial ratios, and key performance indicators (KPIs). Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex information to stakeholders at various levels. Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and build positive relationships with team members and stakeholders. Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. Physical Requirements The physical demands described herein are representative of those which may need to be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Employees must possess the ability to work in an office environment. If required, employees must be able to operate a motor vehicle which may require sitting for prolonged periods of time to visit other company sites. Must have hearing and speech to communicate in person, before groups and over the telephone. Standing in work areas and walking between work areas may be required. This position may require an employee to bend, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, climb or balance, reach, push, and pull. The employee may also be required to lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. PCI Government Services LLC (PCI-GS) is an equal opportunity employer. PCI-GS does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, national origin, religion, marital status, sexual orientation or identity, Veterans or Disability status. Preference may be extended to qualified Native American Indian candidatesin accordance with applicable federal law.

title: Senior Program  Analyst  -  Naval
description: About the Role: At BMNT, Senior Analysts play an integral role in the consultative process that forms the basis for everything we do for our customers. They drive various aspects and key decision points within the project lifecycle, including planning facilitated workshops and engaging key stakeholders. A significant portion of the Senior Analyst role is to oversee problem curation — a specialized tradecraft developed by BMNT to help our customers validate problems worth spending time, energy, and resources to solve — and how it fits into the broader system of innovation at BMNT. A high-performing Senior Analyst will therefore demonstrate expertise in everything we do at BMNT, and is able to effectively demonstrate and communicate BMNT's competitive advantage in order to build credibility and trust with our customers. This specific role resides on the BMNT Naval Team. We are building a high-trust, high-performing team and are seeking a Senior Program Analyst to help deliver support for our U.S. Navy customers, primarily under the Office of Naval Research (ONR). ONR coordinates, executes, and promotes the science and technology programs of the United States Navy and Marine Corps, and this position is a perfect opportunity to have real impact. Location : This is a hybrid position within commuting distance of our Arlington, VA office with the expectation of being in the office two to three days per week but sometimes more often based on customer needs. What You Will Be Doing (Responsibilities): Managing a backlog of tasks sourced from across the program teams, delegating tasks in a Scrummaster-like capacity to ensure timely completion; Conducting independent research and developing project plans that reflect customer needs and the ability to enlist the help from other team members; Establishing strong relationships with customers through developing a positive connection and trust with customers and demonstrates credibility to them; Leading customer meetings and phone calls, including the ability to answer in-depth questions about BMNT methodologies; Quickly understands the scope and root of a problem, synthesizes and analyzes data, and presents findings in a clear, succinct, and polished manner; Leading elements of the customer relationship, including setting agendas and closing-out activities or action items; Identifying secondary and tertiary problems and opportunities that BMNT could address for customers; Independently resolving issues as they arise; Providing guidance, motivation, support, and role modeling to fellow Analysts; Executing problem curation to a high standard with no supervision; Balancing deadlines with personal priorities; Writing well, with very little correction needed from others; Models the desired behaviors of a successful contributor at BMNT and embraces the BMNT Bushido. What We Are Looking For (Qualifications): Excitement for BMNT's mission! A self-starter with an obsession for outcomes, not activities and history of achievements; The ability to provide — in written or verbal form — valuable, succinct, and actionable insights from complicated information; A self-starter with an obsession for outcomes, not activities; Humility and a commitment to self-improvement and self-awareness, including proactively seeking and welcoming constructive feedback from colleagues; Curiosity and an always-be-learning attitude, including recognizing when help is needed and seeking new ideas or perspectives to accomplish an objective; Attention to detail and the ability to manage and prioritize many concurrent tasks; The patience and creativity to overcome barriers to success; At least four to five years of relevant professional experience or two years as a BMNT Analyst; Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience; U.S. citizenship. Active Secret clearance desired or eligibility to obtain a Secret clearance. If you are a self-starter with an obsession for outcomes, not activities and a history of achievements, and enjoy working on projects with collaborative and creative teams, this could be the right role for you! Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. #navy #navalX #innovation #ONR #BMNT #Analyst #defense #Fleet #naval #businessanalyst

title: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst
description: Job#: 2003848 Job Description: Position: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst Location: Remote Summary: Apex Systems has an immediate opening for a cleared Salesforce Business Systems Analyst to suppot our federal client. This individual will play a vital role designing, configuring, testing, and deploying a new case management system and CRM. We are looking for an individual who makes the customer mission their priority in delivering modern, user-centric, and reliable software products to automate manual business processes and workflows. This system directly supports matters of international security and connects 100s of thousands of law enforcement officials Required Skills: Active Secret clearance required Bachelors Degree required Salesforce certifications (Salesforce Certified Business Analyst, Salesforce Certified Consultant) highly preferred 7+ years of experience conducting business analysis and capturing business and technical requirements for IT projects. 3+ years of experience implementing and supporting Salesforce products. Sound understanding of Salesforce best practices and platform limits. Strong knowledge of Salesforce data model and understanding of how to leverage the model to build scalable applications. Demonstrated Experience working in an Agile Environment within the Federal Government. Strong presentation and communication skills. Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with expertise in business process reengineering. Proficiency in business analysis tools and techniques, i.e. data analysis, business process modeling, use case modeling, prototyping/wireframing, cost/benefit analysis, storyboarding, prioritization, decision trees, business rules, root cause analysis. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and tools like Jira, Confluence, or Azure DevOps. Proven track record of problem-solving skills and ability to work on complex projects with cross-functional teams. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks, work independently, and maintain a high degree of attention to detail. Responsibilities: Engage with end users and stakeholders to analyze and understand roles and responsibilities to conduct persona mapping. Conduct business process reengineering by documenting workflows between end users and stakeholders, analyzing inputs and outputs with manual vs automated processes. Document business, functional, and technical requirements and map them to the solutions and desired capabilities. Reviewing existing technical and business documentation to understand existing and legacy system functionality. Drafting user stories, features, and epics for conversation and confirmation with stakeholders Collaborate with the Development Team to develop viable solutions and make recommendations to the Product Owner for implementation. Perform feature and component testing to ensure that the solutions comply with requirements. Support system demos and User Acceptance Testing to document bugs and gather change requests for future sprints. Utilize agile project management and collaboration tools, e.g., Jira, Confluence, Azure DevOps, Miro, Lucid, Visio, Teams, SharePoint Assist in the development of training materials and release notes to aid system adoption and change management. Support configuration management activities through documentation in the code and knowledge repositories within Bitbucket, GitHub, Confluence, Jira, and/or ADO Be an active member of an Agile development team, participating in all Agile ceremonies, updating tasks in Jira/ADO, and continual improvement. Troubleshoot issues in production and non-production. Learn new technical skills to meet the needs of the project and our customers. Estimate the work required for each user story, feature, and epic with story points that establish the product roadmap. Continue to grow as a professional while gaining new technical skills and knowledge. EEO Employer Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. title: Senior Policy Analyst (15.05)
description: OCT Consulting, LLC is an SBA-certified, 8(a) small business management and technology consulting firm that provides support to Federal Government clients. We provide consulting services in the areas of Strategy, Process Improvement, Change Management, Program and Project Management, Acquisition/Procurement, and Information Technology. OCT is currently looking for a Senior Policy Analyst . This position is contingent upon contract award. Roles & Responsibilities: Research and planning for development, coordination, and implementation of policies, strategic plans, and new legislation Support for essential policy, strategy, advisory analysis across various workstreams, including: CIRCIA Notices of Proposed Rulemaking, Sector Structure and SRMA advancement and policy implementation, and strategy and management support to committees such as the Cybersecurity Advisory Committee, NCR Security activity, and JCCG work streams related to National Security Presidential Memoranda (NSPM) 24 Obtain input and support studies, investigations, and analyses of policy objectives at all levels of classification, including engagement with DHS S&T, Academia, Think Tanks, and other subject matter experts Provide support to the development, integration, and implementation of the CISA Strategic Plan, as well as other national-level domestic and international cyber and critical infrastructure strategies Coordinate with Divisions and Mission Enabling Offices to build effective coalitions in support of strategic and/or programmatic objectives, including implementation of CISA Strategy and Division Management Reviews Provide logistical and administrative support (to include agendas, briefing materials, and read-ahead documents) for subject matter briefings and engagements. As directed, attend conferences, meetings, and other engagements and provide back briefs/notes on discussions Coordinate with Divisions to consult on complex national-level policy and strategy initiatives, encourage use of SPP resources, and support development of specific strategies and strategic implementation plans Requirements Security Requirements Must be able to obtain or retain a DoD Top Secret security clearance. Qualifications Active Top Secret Security Clearance at time of award Minimum five (5) years experience federal program and policy management services, policy and strategy analysis, knowledge management, and correspondence and task management Demonstrated experience developing or implementing relevant national-policy and legislation, including PPD-21, PPD-44, and the FY21 NDAA Benefits Benefits The position includes competitive compensation and a full suite of benefits: Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance Retirement savings 401K plan provided by an industry leading provider with 3% employer contributions of the employee's gross salary Paid Time Off and Standard Government Holidays Life Insurance, Short- and Long-Term disability benefits Training Benefits Salary Range: $130,000 - $160,000, commensurate with experience About OCT OCT Consulting LLC is a certified SBA 8(a), minority-owned, small, disadvantaged business providing professional services and information technology solutions to the Federal government and commercial clients. Founded in 2013, we bring the advantage of agility in operations along with a management team with a track record of leading successful engagements at major Federal government agencies. OCT is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. OCT is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Senior Survey Research Analyst
description: Posting Details I. Job Overview Job Description Summary: The George Washington University (GW) Office of Survey Research and Analysis seeks a detail-oriented Senior Survey Research Analyst to plan, gather, analyze, and summarize survey data, in order to provide university stakeholders with reliable and accurate information and analysis with which to make planning decisions. The core responsibilities of this role are to manage the development and analysis of internal and external surveys, including overseeing the creation of the surveys, providing summaries of data, and ensuring that statistical analyses and the merging of survey day with system data are accurate. The Office of Survey Research and Analysis serves the George Washington University by undertaking major survey research about students, faculty, and staff and by coordinating the development, distribution, and analysis of these results. This office conducts social research and analysis to support assessment and accreditation requirements and academic program reviews. Reporting to the Director of Survey Research and Analysis, the Analyst will: Independently conducts and manages survey research of the GW population of undergraduate and graduate students, faculty, and staff. Surveys typically pertain to the education of students and services provided by GW to students, faculty, and staff. Manages all aspects of research projects including the development of online and paper surveys, data cleaning, dissemination and collection, scanning, coding, statistical analysis of data, sampling of GW population, and production of graphs and tables. Writes statistical programs, and determines the appropriate statistical analysis of data. Merges survey data with student records to create comprehensive databases; cleans data sets to ensure data integrity. All work performed and managed includes great attention to detail. Trains staff and student employees to design tables, graphs, and visualizations to display results and data in a simple and straightforward manner; summarizes data for use by deans, vice presidents/provosts, department chairs, and directors. Responds to research queries posted by other GW departments, and delegate these queries as needed. Summarizes research findings and writes reports, and oversees and reviews research findings and reports written by other staff. Trains staff on how to query data and generate reports using statistical software and business intelligence software. Review all work performed to make sure it is accurate. Train staff on the use of survey platforms, office practices and procedures, use of business intelligence software, and platforms to create data visualizations. Develops procedures for and train staff on systematizing data collection and data cleaning for our office and for other collaborating offices. Manages University-wide online course evaluation process including updating the website, inviting department participation, reminding students to complete evaluations, and solving problems about access to the system. Trains department administrators on how to use the system and develop additional questions for evaluations. Supervises and trains work-study students and student assistants on how to code data, use spreadsheets, graphic programs, content analysis, and design surveys. Monitors statistical output of half-time graduate research assistants to ensure the appropriate statistics are being used and that output is accurate. Works cooperatively with the Academic Planning and Assessment, and Office of Institutional Research and Planning; attends meetings and participates on committees as assigned. Performs other related duties as assigned. The omission of specific duties does not preclude the supervisor from assigning duties that are logically related to the position. The position is based at GW’s Foggy Bottom Campus in Washington, DC. Minimum Qualifications Qualified candidates will hold a Bachelor’s degree in an appropriate area of specialization plus 5 years of relevant professional experience, or, a Master’s degree or higher in a relevant area of study plus 3 years of relevant professional experience. Degree must be conferred by the start date of the position. Degree requirements may be substituted with an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Preferred Qualifications Additional Required Licenses/Certifications/Posting Specific Minimum Qualifications: Knowledge of and experience with survey science research methods including focus groups and conducting content analyses of data preferred. Comprehensive understanding of statistical methods and the use of appropriate statistics. Experience with a range of software packages including Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, SAS , Tableau, and Qualtrics desired. Knowledge of relational databases is desired. Hiring Range $72,235.20 - $99,250.68 GW Staff Approach to Pay How is pay for new employees determined at GW? Healthcare Benefits GW offers a comprehensive benefit package that includes medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, time off & leave, retirement savings, tuition, well-being and various voluntary benefits. For program details and eligibility, please visit https://hr.gwu.edu/benefits-programs. II. JOB DETAILS Campus Location: Foggy Bottom, Washington, D.C. College/School/Department: Academic Affairs Family Academic Affairs Sub-Family Institutional Research and Assessment Stream Individual Contributor Level Level 3 Full-Time/Part-Time: Full-Time Hours Per Week: 40 Work Schedule: Monday through Friday, 9:00 am to 6:00 pm Will this job require the employee to work on site? Yes Employee Onsite Status Hybrid Telework: Yes Required Background Check: Criminal History Screening, Education/Degree/Certifications Verification, Social Security Number Trace, and Sex Offender Registry Search Special Instructions To Applicants Employer will not sponsor for employment Visa status Internal Applicants Only? No Posting Number: S013103 Job Open Date: 06/13/2024 Job Close Date If temporary, grant funded or limited term appointment, position funded until: Background Screening Successful Completion of a Background Screening will be required as a condition of hire. EEO Statement The university is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer that does not unlawfully discriminate in any of its programs or activities on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or on any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

title: Business Systems Analyst, Level IV #24095 with Security Clearance
description: Job Description: Aeyon seeks a dedicated Level IV Business Systems Analyst to ensure financial integrity, compliance, and operational effectiveness through rigorous financial management, audit response, internal controls evaluation, and policy development. This requirement will support the Deputy Commandant for Installations and Logistics priorities for modernizing business processes to support an effective internal control program and improve external reporting requirements. This program is a centralized, nationwide program that is responsible for meeting the requirements outlined in the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) Circular A-123 (OMB A-123), OMB Circular A-136 (OMB A-136), the Chief Financial Officer's Act of 1990 and the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publications. Key Responsibilities: Performs independent quality assurance reviews of program performance and deliverables to meet contractual obligations. Responsible for on-site quality control, review, and approval of working papers and findings, and adherence to applicable standards, laws, policies, and regulations. Leads teams for complex work streams and/or are recognized experts in accounting or financial management and business systems. Level IVs primarily interact with FM&C and Government clients at the Division Head and above. Strategic Systems Analysis: Lead the analysis of business requirements to identify and define IT solutions that align with organizational goals and compliance with NIST, FISMA, and FISCAM standards. Conduct high-level evaluations of existing systems and processes, identifying opportunities for optimization and alignment with cybersecurity and risk management frameworks. System Design and Implementation: Design comprehensive IT solutions and strategies that support the Risk Management Framework (RMF) processes, including system categorization, security control selection, and continuous monitoring. Oversee the implementation of designed systems, ensuring they meet all functional and compliance requirements. Compliance and Risk Management: Collaborate with cybersecurity and compliance teams to ensure that all IT systems and projects adhere to required standards and regulations. Participate in the development and execution of strategies for managing IT risks, including conducting risk assessments and recommending mitigation strategies. Stakeholder Engagement and Communication: Serve as a key liaison between IT, business stakeholders, and cybersecurity teams, ensuring clear communication and alignment on project objectives and system requirements. Present complex system designs and strategies to non-technical stakeholders, facilitating understanding and support for IT initiatives. Leadership and Team Collaboration: Lead and mentor junior business systems analysts, promoting a culture of continuous learning and improvement. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that IT solutions are integrated smoothly into business processes and contribute effectively to project goals. Experience supporting systems consolidation/migration, modernization, ERP implementation, IT system audit readiness, IT audit reviews, IT system control documentation, and/or FISCAM and Risk Management Framework (RMF) implementation and sustainment for State or Federal Government agencies or large, complex companies (greater than 1,000) employees. Demonstrated experience in SAP, Oracle Federal Financials, or other relevant financial systems environments. Experience Requirements: Mandatory: Nine (9) years of progressive, relevant experience, including six (6) years of experience leading business systems modernization/sustainment and related projects. Certification Requirements: Mandatory: CISA or similar IT professional certification required. Education Requirements: Mandatory: Four (4) year degree in accounting or business management related field from an accredited institution. Waiverable/Substitutable: An additional two (2) years of relevant experience may substitute for the minimum education requirement. Work Type: Hybrid- Pentagon Clearance Requirements: Active Secret Clearance is Required

title: Senior Analyst, Corporate Development
description: Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, VirginiaSenior Analyst, Corporate Development The Corporate Development Senior Analyst will help execute financial and strategic analysis of specific potential merger & acquisition transactions, as well as more generally evaluate financial and strategic considerations relating to businesses that Capital One operates or may consider entering. The Senior Analyst will be a key team member in support of Capital One’s overall corporate goals. He or she will work closely with other areas of Capital One on these assignments to bring an integrated perspective to the analysis. These areas will include the business lines, corporate strategy group, finance and legal departments. As well as acquisitions, the Principal Analyst may be involved in joint ventures and business or asset divestitures. In addition to analytical support, the Senior Analyst will participate in all transaction phases, including negotiation, structuring, due diligence and integration. Detailed responsibilities will include: Creating and maintaining financial models for acquisitions, joint ventures, or divestitures Structuring analyses efficiently to ensure accurate conclusions with an economy of time and effort Conducting detailed research and strategic analysis on industries and/or companies Working collaboratively across a cross-functional project or deal team to conduct diligence, review transaction documents, or coordinate inputs for financial modeling Working with external counterparties (including companies and external financial, consulting or legal advisors) Developing presentation materials that effectively summarize strategic and financial analysis and key takeaways associated with an opportunity Writing and delivering communications to executive audiences The ideal candidate will possess: Excellent financial modeling skills, including work in some or all of the following: Valuation analysis, Mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures Bank capital measurement / requirement analysis Prior experience in investment banking, corporate development, private equity, hedge fund, product management or transaction valuation preferred Knowledge of financial accounting, capital markets, and valuation concepts Strong research skills Strong problem solving and conceptual thinking skills Advanced communication and presentation skills, both written and oral Demonstrated success with team management and project management, including ability to handle multiple concurrent projects Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree or military experience At least 1 year of experience in financial analysis At least 1 year of experience in investment banking, corporate development, private equity, hedge funds, transaction valuation, product management, or a combination At least 1 year of experience with related software tools including Microsoft Office, Google Suite, Bloomberg, S&P Capital IQ and S&P Capital IQ Pro, or similar or a combination Preferred Qualifications: At least 2 years of experience in investment banking, corporate development, private equity, hedge funds, transaction valuation, product management, or a combination At least 2 years of experience in financial technology, commercial banking, consumer finance, or a combination At least 2 years of experience in financial analysis At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position. Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the Capital One Careers website . Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level. title: Senior Analyst, Global Trade Compliance
description: Job Description: There’s never been a better time to join our team. The thousands of ESAB associates located around the world share a common set of goals and values that drive our success and unparalleled innovation in fabrication technology and specialty gas control equipment. At ESAB, we value and respect everyone’s uniqueness and know that our experiences as individuals strengthen our company. And we know that our ability to collaborate, transform, and empower one another is what makes us unstoppable. With our culture of continuous improvement and innovation and our commitment to living our values, working at ESAB is a career experience like no other. We have more than 9,000 passionate associates in locations across six continents, and we empower our team members to shape the world we imagine every day. If you have a strong desire to be part of a team that delivers cutting-edge innovations and solutions and positively impacts the community, please check out our career opportunities. We help serve a diverse range of industries such as healthcare, automotive, aerospace, renewable energy, robotics, shipbuilding, and so much more. Your Opportunity The Senior Analyst, Global Trade Compliance (“Senior Analyst”) is a key member on the Global Trade Compliance team at ESAB and will report to the VP, Global Trade Compliance. The individual we seek is intellectually curious with a demonstrated background in continuous improvement of trade compliance processes and trade data management to support harmonization of the global trade compliance program globally. The Senior Analyst will have strong trade compliance acumen and practical experience in import law and regulations, with an in-depth knowledge in HTS classification, COO determinations, Customs valuation, and/or FTA qualifications, as well as U.S. export controls. Senior Trade Compliance Analyst will show history of implementing trade compliance systems (from screening tools to automated internal controls), executing change management projects, assessing risks and closing gaps in the import/export processes. Global exposure and experience working with manifold cultures are necessary for success in the role, as the systems and processes span all regions. The Senior Analyst will support projects in various regions, support all GTC members by managing projects or sub-projects autonomously and collaboratively. The primary focus of this role will be on harmonizing trade compliance policies, records, systems, and processes globally while supporting the Global Trade Compliance team with transactional support in North America (NAM) and beyond. This position must be based in Dallas/Fort Worth, TX or North Bethesda, MD (ESAB World Headquarters). Key Responsibilities Ensures compliance is documented throughout the supply chain and systems by maintaining, suggesting, and implementing continuous improvements to existing process workflows. Implements trade systems and internal control applications. Monitors and maintains trade compliance data elements in ESAB companies’ systems by collaborating with IT and other departments. Supports integration of data, systems, and procedures. Manages Customs broker performance and improves processes around import compliance. Continuously improves the processes related to export controls, customs broker management, management of HTS, Export Control Numbers, Country of Origin (“COO”). Identifies procedural gaps and areas of improvement and opportunity in import or export processes. Manages day-to-day compliance issues, provides guidance, and supports related projects in NAM and other regions. Trains associates on relevant trade compliance topics and processes. Performs other duties as assigned. What We Are Looking For Bachelor’s degree in International Trade, Engineering, Finance, Business, Law, Supply Chain, Logistics, Data Analysis, or similar analytical disciplines. At least eight (“8”) years of experience in import/export operations, with at least two (“2”) years of direct experience in tariff classifications, Free Trade Agreements (preferential treatment programs), and/or export sanctions laws and processes. Project management experience. Proven data science or analysis experience with the demonstrated experience in automation of the processes and the AI applications. Advanced level in MS Excel, including, but not limited to V-look up, macros, formula use, pivot tables, and visualization. Strong written and oral communication skills in English with a demonstrated history of writing policies and procedures based on trade laws and regulations. Preferred Accreditation in trade compliance such as the HTS classifications (e.g., licensed Customs broker, Certified HTS Specialist), CUSECO, or the like Project Management Professional (“PMP”) or other certifications. Experience using automated solutions for repetitive tasks or streamlining various requests. Experience using and implementing applications for creating trade attributes (HTS, COO, ECCN). Work experience at Big Four (KPMG, Deloitte, EY, PwC), a trade law practice, or a trade consulting firm. Coding skills, AI applications, other. Competencies & Behaviors Needed Strong and effective communicator with various audiences, with varied styles of delivery, depending on the subject(s) under discussion. Seeks to develop trust, responds with a sense of urgency, self-motivation to complete requests timely. Strong organizational skills with the use of applications that allow one to stay organized. Remain ethical and straightforward around the mistakes, when such may take place (own and those of others), with the drive to correct them, offer a solution, resolve problems, remain positively minded. Be self-aware and socially aware, be capable of managing one’s emotions while extending empathy to their colleagues. Embrace ESAB values, behaviors, and principles, as well as ESAB Business System. Drive continuous improvement. Build relationships and trust across functions while staying firm in the requirements around trade compliance and all ESAB policies. Include others in both solution-making and implementation. Consciously aim for a win-win solution in all discussions. Put forward strong collaboration skills across functions and business platforms. Be comfortable working in a global organization, while aiming to learn about various cultural differences to respect them. Suggest solutions and implement them with specific goals and continuous results. Moves with thoughtful speed on new projects. Focus on delivering results through continuous improvement. Know their areas for technical and soft skills’ improvement through seeking partnership with people who already have these skills developed to grow both technically and emotionally. Continuously learn and professionally develop. Lead with humility and accountability for themselves and others. Influence others by finding common business goals. Aim to support their team and other teams while being an excellent individual contributor. Additional Key Attributes Integrity, credibility, and character with demonstrated ethical behaviors. Demonstrate a high degree of maturity and business judgment. A team player and leader with the self-confidence, humility, and consultative skills to positively influence the business. A tenacious, operationally minded individual with a strong work ethic. Self-aware with the goal to continuously self-improve. Inclusive and supportive, aware of others needs and concerns. Capable of stretching oneself by taking on new challenges. Travel Requirements Ability and willingness to travel within the U.S. and internationally to support ESAB businesses. Travel is approximately 10% within NAM, 10% within SAM, and 5% beyond the NAM / SAM regions. Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO): As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of sex, color, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability, age, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions), religion, military/veteran status, national origin, marital status, family or caregiver responsibilities, or any other characteristic or status protected by law.

title: Senior Consultant, Business Strategy and Transformation with Security Clearance
description: Senior Consultant, Business Strategy and Transformation This position requires an active IRS MBI Clearance clearance or the ability to obtain a IRS MBI Clearance Trust clearance to be considered. Cherokee Nation Solutions Link is seeking a talented Senior Consultant, Business Strategy and Transformation to join our team in the Washington, DC area. This is a client-facing role where you will have the opportunity to lead high-profile workstreams, manage client engagements, and oversee the creation of deliverables from inception to completion. You will be working with a federal agency undergoing enterprise-wide change, offering a unique chance to engage with senior executives and influence significant transformation initiatives. Compensation & Benefits: Estimated Starting Salary Range for Senior Consultant, Business Strategy and Transformation: [Enter$] Pay commensurate with experience. Full time benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, and other possible benefits as provided. Benefits are subject to change with or without notice. Senior Consultant, Business Strategy and Transformation Responsibilities Include: Conduct research, analyze data, and develop strategic recommendations to improve business processes and governance practices: Perform comprehensive research and data analysis to identify areas for improvement and formulate actionable recommendations. Utilize quantitative and qualitative data to assess current processes and identify inefficiencies. Develop strategic recommendations to enhance governance practices and streamline operations. Lead workstreams and manage client engagements, ensuring the successful delivery of projects: Oversee workstreams, coordinating efforts to ensure timely and successful project completion. Manage client relationships and serve as the primary point of contact for project-related communications. Ensure project deliverables meet client expectations and adhere to agreed-upon timelines and budgets. Oversee the creation of deliverables such as reports, presentations, process flows, project plans, operational guides, best practices, change management plans, and communications plans, ensuring alignment with project objectives and client expectations: Develop high-quality deliverables, including detailed reports, visual presentations, and comprehensive process documentation. Create process flows, project plans, and operational guides to support project implementation. Design change management and communications plans to facilitate smooth transitions and stakeholder buy-in. Facilitate stakeholder engagement and support project management activities across various transformation and change management initiatives: Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements, address concerns, and ensure alignment with project goals. Support project management activities, including scheduling, resource allocation, and risk management. Facilitate workshops, meetings, and discussions to drive consensus and advance project objectives. Apply strategic thinking and problem-solving skills to develop innovative solutions to complex business challenges faced by clients: Utilize strategic thinking and analytical skills to address complex business problems. Develop innovative solutions that drive organizational improvements and achieve client objectives. Continuously refine and adapt strategies based on evolving client needs and industry trends. Serve as a facilitator, working directly with clients to guide and implement strategic initiatives: Act as a trusted advisor to clients, providing guidance on strategic initiatives and transformation efforts. Facilitate the implementation of strategic plans, ensuring alignment with client objectives and organizational goals. Provide ongoing support and expertise to clients throughout the project lifecycle. Lead/support a small delivery team to service client needs effectively: Oversee and mentor junior consultants and analysts, ensuring high-quality deliverables and client satisfaction. Coordinate team activities and provide direction to achieve project milestones and objectives. Foster a collaborative and supportive team environment, encouraging professional growth and development. Perform other job-related duties as assigned. Senior Consultant, Business Strategy and Transformation Experience, Education, Skills, Abilities requested: Bachelor's degree in business, management, or a related field. Master's degree is preferred. 6-8 years of consulting experience, preferably in a federal setting. Prior experience in a PMO or project management role. Demonstrated ability to build and maintain effective relationships with clients and internal teams. Proven track record in business process improvement, governance work, policy analysis, and change management. Ability to analyze complex data, trends, and information to derive insights and develop strategic recommendations. Proficiency in developing and implementing business plans that align with organizational objectives. Excellent written and verbal communication skills to convey complex ideas and recommendations clearly. Must pass pre-employment qualifications of Cherokee Federal. Must be able to obtain/maintain a Public Trust clearance. * preferred qualifications: Prior experience in top-tier management consulting, strategy consulting, or a related field is preferred. Experience working with the IRS is highly preferred. Project Management and/or Change Management certifications are desirable Must pass pre-employment qualifications of Cherokee Federal Company Information: Cherokee Nation Solution Link (CNSL) is a part of Cherokee Federal - the division of tribally owned federal contracting companies owned by Cherokee Nation Businesses. As a trusted partner for more than 60 federal clients, Cherokee Federal LLCs are focused on building a brighter future, solving complex challenges, and serving the government's mission with compassion and heart. To learn more about CNSL, visit cherokee-federal.com. #CherokeeFederal  Cherokee Federal is a military friendly employer. Veterans and active military transitioning to civilian status are encouraged to apply. Similar searchable job titles: Strategy Analyst Business Transformation Consultant Corporate Strategy Consultant Organizational Change Analyst Transformation Program Consultant Keywords: Strategic Planning Organizational Change Business Transformation Leadership Alignment Change Management Legal Disclaimer: Cherokee Federal is an equal opportunity employer. Please visit cherokee-federal.com/careers for information regarding our Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Statement, and Accommodation request. Many of our job openings require access to government buildings or military installations. Candidates must pass pre-employment qualifications of Cherokee Federal.

title: Senior Investor Relations Analyst
description: Job Description CoStar Group (NASDAQ: CSGP) is a leading global provider of commercial and residential real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Included in the S&P 500 Index and the NASDAQ 100, CoStar Group is on a mission to digitize the world’s real estate, empowering all people to discover properties, insights and connections that improve their businesses and lives. We have been living and breathing the world of real estate information and online marketplaces for over 35 years, giving us the perspective to create truly unique and valuable offerings to our customers. We’ve continually refined, transformed and perfected our approach to our business, creating a language that has become standard in our industry, for our customers, and even our competitors. We continue that effort today and are always working to improve and drive innovation. This is how we deliver for our customers, our employees, and investors. By equipping the brightest minds with the best resources available, we provide an invaluable edge in real estate. Role Description: The day-to-day responsibilities of the Senior Investor Relations Analyst will center around providing administrative support for the investor relations team. Specifically, they will manage and maintain critical investor data including meeting tracking and reporting. This person should have excellent organization and communication skills as well a history of success working in a fast-paced environment. In addition, the Senior Investor Relations Analyst should be a self-starter and team player. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who is interested in learning the CoStar business as well as gaining experience in an investor facing role. Responsibilities Responsible for the coordination of all investor relations events as well as executing complex and confidential administrative assignments. Act as a key point of contact for the investment community for calls and meetings, including managing inbound requests to the IR email and as designated by the Head of IR. Manage our investor microsite and the relationship with the vendor, regularly monitor for updates. Keep NASDAQ database of all interfaces with investors calls, visits or emails current. Pull quarterly Dashboard and stock reports and report on internal metrics to Head of IR. Event coordination for investor days and HQ visits, including space management, technology set up, catering and other event related elements. Responsible for managing the earnings logistics for our quarterly public company earnings process, including set up of the preliminary earnings announcement, management of website postings and facilitation of the quarterly earnings call. Investor conference and Roadshow coordination, registration and meeting management. Investor research and targeting. Need to be able to multi-task different projects at the same time adapt to change well. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree from an accredited, not-for-profit University or College. 5+ years of investor relations support experience Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite required including advanced computer and process skills. Highly organized with the ability to manage several projects at once. Excellent communication skills both written and verbal required. A track record of commitment to prior employers. Evidence of strong academic performance in college. What’s in it for you? When you join CoStar Group, you’ll experience a collaborative and innovative culture working alongside the best and brightest to empower our people and customers to succeed. We offer you generous compensation and performance-based incentives. CoStar Group also invests in your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our Benefits Package Includes (but Is Not Limited To) Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug Life, legal, and supplementary insurance Virtual and in-person mental health counseling services for individuals and family Commuter and parking benefits 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions Employee stock purchase plan Paid time off Tuition reimbursement On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes Access to CoStar Group’s Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Employee Resource Groups Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks We welcome all qualified candidates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar Group is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. This position offers a base salary range of $89,900-$158,300, based on relevant skills and experience and includes a generous benefits plan. CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing

title: Business System Analyst
description: Job Category: Information Technology Time Type: Full time Minimum Clearance Required to Start: TS/SCI with Polygraph Employee Type: Regular Percentage Of Travel Required Type of Travel: * * * What You’ll Get To Do You will get to directly support mission. Provide direct user support and response to customers using AEA Tools for questions regarding account administration, system and network status. Support/interface with the Customer via phone, VTC, email, chat, and applicable online presence, such as JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, and SpySpace. More About The Role Respond to system issues and perform first level corrective maintenance Enter issues via a problem tracking tool Follow and maintain current AEA Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and documented AEA Outreach Service Level Agreements (SLAs) Responds to complicated user questions Escalate complex system questions to Tier II & III Support and appropriate Government stakeholders Escalate complex issues within the SD Outreach Team Monitor the health and status of current AEA systems Prepare routine metrics and system availability reports Identify common user challenges and work with development teams, UX teams, and product leads Shall maintain and update the ticket tracking tool Create metrics reports for system availability as well as user support Assist in orienting, training, assigning, and checking the work of lower level employees Provides advice, guidance, and direction to other technical help desk technicians with complicated user questions or requests Interacts with the Government regarding Systems Engineering technical considerations and for associated problems, issues or conflicts Provide first line communications to the customer CSC team to ensure appropriate operational awareness is available in a timely and concise manner Create additional SOPs as needed to perform corrective maintenance Provide data flow troubleshooting, network troubleshooting, troubleshooting and diagnosing software and hardware issues Provide customer follow up to ensure questions have been answered and collect feedback Work in a collaborate environment You’ll Bring These Qualifications SIGINT experience using mission analytic tools 3 years of demonstrated hands-on experience with AEA or Intelligence Community (IC) tools and capabilities High school diploma or equivalent required Understanding of product workflows in an operational setting These Qualifications Would Be Nice To Have Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university is highly desired Operational experience as an analyst preferred Familiarity with query languages Experience working with forward deployed users Experience providing direct user support and troubleshooting directly with the user Experience gathering requirements from users Experience providing overall process improvement and agile efficiencies supporting the existing customer base Experience with JIRA and Confluence What We Can Offer You We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities. We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities. For over 60 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success. This position is contingent on funding and may not be filled immediately. However, this position is representative of positions within CACI that are consistently available. Individuals who apply may also be considered for other positions at CACI. ______________________________________________________________________________ What You Can Expect A culture of integrity. At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation. An environment of trust. CACI takes pride in fostering a diverse and accessible culture where every individual feels supported to chart their own path. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality. A focus on continuous growth. Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy. Your potential is limitless. So is ours. Learn more about CACI here. ______________________________________________________________________________ Pay Range : There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here. The Proposed Salary Range For This Position Is $78,700 - $165,300 CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

title: EPM Senior Consultant
description: OVERVIEW: Cirrus ERP is a different kind of consulting firm. By pairing our collaborative no-ego environment with a results-oriented mindset, this enables our dynamic professionals the opportunity to have their voices heard when delivering client services. At Cirrus, we advise, implement, and operate transformational solutions that deliver unique business insights from planning and budgeting through targeted business analytics. We are looking to bring on a Senior Consultant-Manager who will provide Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) Solutions and Services. In this role, you will collaborate with clients to design, develop, and deploy innovative technologies such as NetSuite Planning & Budgeting (NSPB), but also provide functional expertise and skills in financial planning. You will have the opportunity to join our collaborative and innovative team where you can make a significant impact and help our clients optimize their decision-making and drive business growth. WORK YOU’LL DO / RESPONSIBILITIES: · Contribute to business process definition, functional design, and technology enablement, utilizing predictive analytics techniques to analyze client data, uncover valuable insights, and provide actionable recommendations. · Lead Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) engagements while contributing to other workstream(s) of various EPM/CPM solutions such as NetSuite Planning & Budgeting (NSPB), Oracle EPM Cloud, IBM Planning Analytics and more. · You will have the ability to share new ideas, lead and collaborate with team members on projects, all without the extensive demands of travel. · Assist our clients with developing transformational roadmaps that guide the maturation of their FP&A function and technology infrastructure. · Provide alternatives and recommendations based on best practices and application functionality to CFOs, COOs, CIOs, and key executives of our clients. REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE: · Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Enterprise Performance Management, specifically FP&A related activities. · Demonstrable experience with 3rd Party Vendor management. · Experience building financial models and FP&A software · Knowledge of market-leading solutions in the FP&A industry. · Good time management, interpersonal, communication, organizational and decision-making skills. · Ample experience in client-facing roles. · Experience of working within complex, matrixed multi-location, and multi-cultural teams. · Excellent English language skills – written and verbal. EDUCATION · Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Business, Finance, Information Systems, Accounting, or other technical discipline. · One or more professional certifications to supplement formal education in support of analytics function. · US work authorization PREFERRED SKILLS AND CERTIFICATIONS: · FP&A: Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) and Certified Corporate FP&A Professional (FPAC) · EPM: NetSuite Planning & Budgeting (NSPB), Oracle EPM, and Planning Analytics (TM1) · Analytics: Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) and/or NetSuite Analytics Warehouse (NSAW), and Power BI · ERP: NetSuite ERP *Please note* · Though this is a hybrid role, candidates should be comfortable commuting to our office or a client site when needed. Perks that make working with Cirrus ERP even more rewarding: à · Intelligent and well-rounded professionals who bring a refreshing change from the large consulting firm environment. · The Cirrus Culture: Feeling valued and knowing your contributions make a difference does not go unnoticed at Cirrus Partners. With our Culture Club, we organize different ways of rewarding each other through recognition and special team and company events. At Cirrus Partners, we are stronger together. · Professional Development/Continuous learning: Giving employees the platform to pursue their interests leads to a greater sense of purpose and accomplishment. Therefore, every person, regardless of title or seniority, is encouraged to pursue their professional goals and we support you on that journey. We will help you stay on track and will reimburse 100% of the cost for professional certifications (e.g., professional membership dues and license fees). · Hybrid working environment: While we understand that working from home has many benefits, including flexibility and improved work – life balance, we also believe great value is still gained from working alongside your peers in person. Studies show it can be easier to form meaningful relationships when working with peers in person. That being said, we allow our employees to work remotely whenever possible. · Philanthropic involvement: We love to give back to the local community and we support the environment through giving to organizations focused on helping clean up and rebuild our ocean ecosystems. · Our office is located in the heart of Clarendon, Virginia just 2 blocks away from the Clarendon Metro Stop with numerous restaurants and bars within walking distance. This makes it easy for us to have company lunches and after work happy hours. Awards · 2022 Best of Arlington Award · Back-to-back recipient of Inc. fastest-growing private companies award Equal Opportunity Employer Cirrus ERP is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

title: Senior Research Analyst
description: Overview Nakupuna Consulting is looking to hire a Senior Research Analyst to support a DoD client within the Office of the Secretary of Defense, in executing the research and analytical support requirements of a federal advisory committee. The Senior Research Analyst will support the client in leading studies on innovation within national security. Our team will work to design and present informative learning sessions on business practices related to innovation, according to relevant legislative and executive guidance . The role requires a proactive problem solver with excellent communication and collaboration skills. Responsibilities The following reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Management may assign additional duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Collaborate with senior DoD and Government officials on research projects that may cover topics related to strategic management, organizational change, national security, emerging technologies, industry disruptors, and other strategic concepts. Design and lead research studies. Leverage research and analysis to develop recommendations and draft professional reports and briefings. Develop stakeholder engagement plans and analyses. Conduct interviews with technical SMEs, Government officials, and industry leaders to gather information for analysis. Design and present sessions on business practices related to innovation, such as design thinking, human-centered design, entrepreneurship, and process improvement. Use statistical techniques, models, and methodologies. Encourage and foster creativity and innovative thinking among the team to deliver novel tools and concepts. Qualifications Qualifications: Experience designing and conducting research studies related to national security activities and high-level policy issues. Experience to include assessing research needs; conducting literature review; identifying appropriate areas of research; considering the research’s feasibility, priorities, methodologies, and procedures; gathering of information; developing assessment criteria; and identifying and analyzing issues. Ability to conduct statistical analysis and determine statistical accuracy. Experience developing professional, senior-level reports, briefings, studies, and presentations. Proven experience collaborating with senior officials and teams. Ability to work under pressure and to adapt quickly in a changing environment. Excellent oral and written communication skills required. Highly skilled in Microsoft Office Suite and SharePoint. Education and Experience: This position requires seven years of relevant professional experience. Experience working in or directly for the Government is required. This position requires a Master's Degree from an accredited university or college. Clearance: This position requires an active Secret security clearance. Must be a U.S. citizen. Physical Requirements: The ideal candidate must at a minimum be able to meet the following physical requirements of the job with or without a reasonable accommodation : Ability to perform repetitive motions with the hands, wrists, and fingers. Ability to engage in and follow audible communications in emergency situations. Ability to sit for prolonged periods at a desk and working on a computer. The Nakupuna Companies are dedicated to fostering an inclusive work environment while providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you require special assistance or accommodations during your job application process, please contact recruiting@nakupuna.com .

title: Project Management Analyst
description: Project Management Analyst: Distribution Program Pay Rate: $74 Per Hour; W2 Only Location: Washington DC - close to the White House - Hybrid position - 2/3 days in office and remote 2 Year Contract Job Description This position is as a Project Management Analyst (PMA) supporting the Distribution Program Management Office (DPMO) This position provides day to day support of a Sr. Project Manager at PHI responsible for a variety of electric utility distribution programs and projects, primarily in Washington DC area Roles And Responsibilities Of The PMA Include Support on a variety of project analytical activities, contract administration including supporting development of RFP's for distribution programs Creation of contract requisitions, contract payment authorizations, invoice review and approval, accruals, and overall contract tracking responsibilities Managing a large amount of program level data that is tracked through a variety of programs including Microsoft Excel, Microsoft SharePoint, and Microsoft PowerBI Successful candidates must have strong analytic skills including specific experience with advanced functions in Excel including formulas, pivot tables, Vlookup, etc

title: Sales Operations Consultant
description: Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact. Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community to get relevant job alerts straight to your inbox. This role supports the Americas Sales Operations Leader and will lead the daily operational cadence of the sales organization. This individual will be part analyst, process developer, and coach. She is first, and foremost, an enabler to the sales leaders, constantly working to simplify and/or eliminate the administrative barriers to selling. Of primary concern is the pipeline and forecast management process. He will also provide analytical expertise to target growth opportunities, problem solve issues, or predict results of investment options. Finally, she will coach other members of the growing team. This position requires extensive sales knowledge to understand the day-to-day experience and anticipate the needs of quota-carrying stakeholders. This person must develop rapport and credibility with the sales leaders and sellers, so people skills (empathy, forthrightness, and presence) are critical. Knowledge of the field that Ciena operates in is beneficial. Responsibilities Include Drive Sales productivity by optimizing processes to meet Sales where they are and support them in the future. Act as subject matter expert for Americas sales data and forecasting process. Lead efforts to ensure SalesForce is properly utilized and appropriate deal hygiene is maintained. Design and execute reporting to account leaders on Sales pipeline status, KPIs Provide operational expertise to analyze and execute territory management and quota distribution efforts Conduct critical analyses in support of the business Lead problem solving efforts on operational issues within the business. Coach other team members on best practices and communication strategies Partner with critical groups like finance, product, and global sales operations to deliver functional initiatives. Preferred Skills Excellent communication, interpersonal and collaboration skills Personal commitment to customer service and building relationships Is a team player with a collaborative approach to problem solving Required Experience Bilingual: Spanish (native), English (Conversational) Bachelors Degree in Business Management or related/equivalent 5+ years in a sales or sales support function Significant experience with SalesForce.com is a must. Ideally this person will have multiple years of hands-on opportunity management and dashboard/report usage and creation. Significant experience coordinating with Finance and/or Marketing operations organizations is desired. 2 years in high value/low volume tech is highly desired Strong Excel/Data Base experience Compensation And Benefits The annual pay range for this position is $103,700 - $171,300 Pay ranges at Ciena are designed to accommodate variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions, and locations, reflecting our diverse products, industries, and lines of business. Please note that the pay range information provided in this posting pertains specifically to the primary location, which is the top location listed in case multiple locations are available. Non-Sales employees may be eligible for a discretionary incentive bonus, while Sales employees may be eligible for a sales commission. In addition to competitive compensation, Ciena offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision plans, participation in 401(K) (USA) & DCPP (Canada) with company matching, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company-paid holidays, paid sick leave, and vacation time. We also comply with all applicable laws regarding Paid Family Leave and other leaves of absence. Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community to get relevant job alerts straight to your inbox. At Ciena, we are committed to building and fostering an environment in which our employees feel respected, valued, and heard. Ciena values the diversity of its workforce and respects its employees as individuals. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination. Ciena is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status.
