title: Business Analyst--WA Area
description: Business Analyst Location: Remote, but need someone in Seattle, WA Area only , since this will possibly turn perm and they are looking to be hybrid onsite in the future. - Candidates with in Seattle, WA only Must have active and genuine LinkedIn Need SSN Last 4 Digit and DOB Need Photo ID We are currently seeking a skilled Business Analyst to join our team and contribute to the successful implementation of the Mistral project. Position Overview: As a Business Analyst, you will play a key role in the Mistral project, focusing on the implementation of a crew management system and reporting functionalities for an Onboarding HR system. This position requires a dynamic individual with expertise in SQL, Business Intelligence (BI), Microsoft 365 suite, particularly Excel and Outlook, as well as demonstrated experience in business analysis and project management. Experience in the cruise industry is advantageous, and excellent communication skills are essential for collaborating with stakeholders across multi-level organizations. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements for the Mistral project, focusing on crew implementation and reporting aspects. Utilize SQL and BI tools to extract, transform, and analyze data, providing insights and recommendations to support decision-making processes. Work closely with the project team to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables, ensuring alignment with business goals and timelines. Conduct gap analysis and identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization within the crew management and onboarding HR systems. Serve as a liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders, translating business needs into technical requirements and vice versa. Develop and maintain project documentation, including requirements documents, process flows, and user manuals. Support user acceptance testing (UAT) and facilitate training sessions for end-users as needed. Monitor project progress, identify risks and issues, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure successful project delivery. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or related field. Proven experience as a Business Analyst, with a strong background in SQL, BI, and Microsoft 365 suite. Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools, with PM knowledge preferred. Experience in the cruise industry is a plus. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a proactive and collaborative approach. Flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and project requirements.

title: Business Analyst- Pharma
description: Job description: Capgemini Engineering is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to work closely with Business Product Owner in an Agile environment for product deployment, improvement and/or roll-out that support the business processes (e.g., management of human biological samples, definition of clinical assays and lab testing activities)! Key responsibilities: We will collaborate closely with end-users: Understand and becomes authoritative in the processes supported by the systems; Lead exploratory workshops w/ different techniques (e.g., story mapping, wireframing, etc.); Collect, formalize, challenge and endorse business requirements (in the form of user stories and acceptance criteria); Present demos! Coordinate testing sessions: Liaise with TECH team members to organize all development phases (sprints definition, demo, testing phase, migration, validation, launch, etc.); Write system development-related documentation (user requirements, test protocols, migration requirements, user manual, etc.) Perform deep and intensive exploratory testing of the solution as well as formal validation. Ensure adequate communication to customers and sponsors. Ensure regular and efficient follow-up and customer concern of actions, decisions, risks and issues. Support and chip in significantly to organizational change activities: accompany the users through changes on their processes. Chip into the team Agile transformation: process, ways of working set-up, tools, etc. Ensure product and system training and sharing of knowledge. Point of contact for troubleshooting issues related to the system. Mitigate and resolve information system issues in a timely manner! Required Skills Take active part (assist Business Product Owner in an Agile product squad) to products deployment, improvement and/or roll-out that support the business processes (e.g. management of human biological samples, definition of clinical assays and lab testing activities) We as a team ensure adequate communication to partners and sponsors. Perform deep and intensive exploratory testing of the solution as well as formal validation. We as a team ensure regular and efficient follow-up and customer concern of actions, decisions, risks and issues. Support and chip in significantly to organizational change activities: accompany the users through changes on their processes. We chip into the team Agile transformation: process, ways of working set-up, tools, etc. Ensure product and system training and sharing of knowledge. Point of contact for troubleshooting issues related to the system. Mitigate and resolve information system issues in a timely manner. Life at Capgemini Capgemini supports all aspects of your well-being throughout the changing stages of your life and career. For eligible employees, we offer: Flexible work Healthcare including dental, vision, mental health, and well-being programs Financial well-being programs such as 401(k) and Employee Share Ownership Plan Paid time off and paid holidays Paid parental leave Family building benefits like adoption assistance, surrogacy, and cryopreservation Social well-being benefits like subsidized back-up child/elder care and tutoring Mentoring, coaching and learning programs Employee Resource Groups Disaster Relief About Capgemini Engineering World leader in engineering and R&D services, Capgemini Engineering combines its broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software to support the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Coupled with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has more than 55,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including Aeronautics, Space, Defense, Naval, Automotive, Rail, Infrastructure & Transportation, Energy, Utilities & Chemicals, Life Sciences, Communications, Semiconductor & Electronics, Industrial & Consumer, Software & Internet. title: Business Analyst
description: Our Company: Tactiq is a fast growing, innovative software solutions provider focusing on bridging the gap between retailers, manufacturers, and distributors. We use world-class technology to support both retailers and suppliers within the DSD industry by standardizing communications and streamlining invoicing. Tactiq is uniquely positioned to increase both operational efficiency and service quality, with a proven track record of driving sales growth and cost savings for our partners. Our People: Our team members join Tactiq to learn, develop, and be part of an environment that rewards performance and innovation while providing opportunities to personally excel and grow. We work closely as a team, respect each other as professionals, and move decisively on meeting the needs of our partners, all guided by our values - Do the right thing, Win as a team lose as a team, Own it, Embrace the messy, and Think like your customer. Job description: We are looking for an experienced Business Systems Analyst who is passionate about working with business and product teams to play a key role in analyzing, understanding and documenting business needs and processes. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to review business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial, and technical risks. Your goal will be to identify opportunities to improve efficiency that deliver on the company's vision and strategy. The successful candidate will possess strong analytical skills, exceptional problem-solving abilities, and the ability to clearly communicate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Requirements Responsibilities: Conduct in-depth analysis of processes, systems, and data to identify opportunities for improvement Prepare clear requirements, specifications, and recommendations facilitating improved business processes through collaboration, research, and analysis Work with customers/stakeholders to examine and document current business processes and identify opportunities to better utilize existing technology and human resources Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure effective communication and collaboration Develop and maintain business process documentation, including process flows, use cases, and functional specifications Conduct requirements gathering sessions and facilitate workshops to elicit business requirements Perform data analysis, data validation, and data mapping to ensure data integrity and accuracy Partner with business and product teams to document and identify impact, risk, and benefits of alternative solutions Requirements and skills: Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field preferred Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and strategically Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner Proficiency in process mapping and modeling techniques Experience with data analysis and reporting tools such as SQL, Excel, and Tableau Familiarity with Agile methodologies and frameworks Self-starter with a track record of working independently and collaboratively Benefits Benefits At Tactiq, we believe in creating a work environment where everyone is welcome to be themselves. With a focus on diversity and inclusivity, individuals are able to contribute and bring their best selves to a winning team environment. We invest heavily in the development of our people and provide opportunities and support for our team to invest back into causes they care about. We offer an extensive employee benefits package because we know that our people and what they care about matter most. If you're looking to work for a company that values family, authenticity, inclusivity, hard work, determination, and problem-solving, then we're the right fit for you! Included benefits: Health Care Plans (Medical, Dental & Vision) 401k plan with company match Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D) Paid Time Off (including time for volunteering) & Public Holidays Generous Parental Leave Short Term & Long Term Disability Training & Development opportunities Work From Home & Flexible work arrangements Free Food & Snacks Wellness Resources

title: Business Analyst
description: Hii , This is Vamshi ,from Software Technologies We have a job opening with our client for position of Business Analyst/Governance Analyst you are available and looking for any new opportunities, please send me your updated resume for below position ASAP. Job Title: Business Analyst/IN-IDOH Governance Analyst Duration: Long term Location: Remote Description The Governance Analyst position, within the Office of Data & Analytics (ODA), supports key data governance initiatives in alignment with Project Data, Analytics, Reporting, and Technology Transformation (DARTT). Position Description As a member of the Office of Data & Analytics (ODA) and under the direction of the Data Governance Lead, the Governance Analyst (GA) will collaborate with the agency divisions and regional support teams to document proposed technical/data solutions, processes, policies, standards, best practices, and the like. The GA will represent these needs to agency management and executive leadership and engage in both strategic and operational planning for the continuous improvement of generating the various technology and data outcomes in alignment with the agency's 2021-2025 strategic plan and objectives. Job Duties Develop and manage metadata and data dictionaries for IDOH principal data assets. Identify the technical metadata sources, define business contextual enrichment requirements, define user training requirements, and define user access permissions needed to support the business use cases. Assume overall responsibility for the successful execution of assigned data governance projects. Provide assistance to IDOH divisions for the creation of data governance initiatives and KPIs Work to create and maintain robust data documentation for all IDOH data sources, in partnership with the Data Engagement, Data Management and Data Engineering teams. Assist in the roll out of the IDOH data governance framework, with a focus on improving data quality and protecting sensitive data through enhancements to existing policies/procedures, standards, governance metrics, tools and data architecture. Collaborate with the Data Management and Data Engineering teams to design data quality checks to ensure validity and cleanliness of agency datasets prior to their use in analysis reporting. Define roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of IDOH principal data assets. Serve as a liaison between IDOH division and technical teams to ensure that data-related business requirements for protecting sensitive data are clearly defined communicated, and well-understood as part of operational prioritization and planning. Assist with the development and maintenance of an inventory of IDOH information maps, including authoritative systems and owners. Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards, and adoption requirements across the agency. Assist Data Governance Lead and Director of Data Operations, Governance and Engagement with identifying new opportunities for data governance improvement throughout the agency and mobilizing resources to implement change. Resolve issues escalated from IDOH division data governance representatives. Provide progress reports to leadership and oversee periodic updates to the data governance roadmap. Identify new business opportunities pertaining to the use of data assets to achieve efficiency and effectiveness; represent data as a strategic business asset. Support the IDOH Data Transformation Office, as requested. Requirements A bachelor's degree from an accredited university in Information Technology, Computer Science, Public Health, Epidemiology, Statistics, Analytics, Programming, or related field; or equivalent experience. 2 + years of relevant business analyst and/or project management experience. Demonstrated experience in leadership and/or mentorship in a professional or academic setting. Experience with large-scale data or project management and oversight. Specific and extensive knowledge of data governance best practices, business and technology issues related to management of enterprise assets and approaches to data protection. Knowledge of data-related government regulatory requirements and emerging trends and issues. Demonstrated consulting skills, with change management concepts and strategies, including communication, culture change, and performance management system design. Knowledge of data architecture and technology solutions. Demonstrated ability to quickly adapt and use novel tools, as needed. Experience in leading workshops or training sessions with a user community is a plus. Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities. Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written. Excellent change management and relationship management skills. Ability to work in a team environment with multiple and fluid demands. Ability to maintain effective and professional working relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Thanks, Vamshi Thangadpalli Technical Recruiter Direct: 404-777-9837 | Fax: 866-608-6686 Email: vamshi.t@stiorg.com | Web: www.stiorg.com https://www.linkedin.com/in/vamshi-thangadpalli-3a0415251/ 100 Overlook Center, Suite 200 Princeton, NJ 08540.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Description: As a business analyst within our projects department, you will play a crucial role in the successful execution of large, complex IT projects. Your experience in Scrum methodology and hands-on involvement in similar environments will be vital in driving our projects forward. Below are detailed responsibilities and requirements for this role: Responsibilities: Utilize Scrum methodology to guide project teams through the development lifecycle, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to project goals. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document project requirements, ensuring alignment with business needs and objectives. Lead sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives, fostering a collaborative and productive team environment. Facilitate communication between development teams and stakeholders, ensuring clear understanding of project requirements and progress. Monitor project progress and identify potential risks or obstacles, implementing mitigation strategies to ensure successful project outcomes. Provide leadership and guidance to project teams, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. Conduct post-project reviews to evaluate performance and identify areas for improvement, implementing lessons learned into future projects. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in a system engineering, business, or information technology-related area. Excellent English communication skills (verbal and written), with full bilingual proficiency. Strong business acumen, with the ability to understand and analyze complex business requirements. Leadership experience, with a proven track record of effectively leading project teams. Experience in business analysis, including requirement gathering, analysis, and documentation. Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office tools, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Scrum Master or Product Owner Certification (preferred), demonstrating proficiency in Scrum methodology. IIBA Business Analysis Certification (preferred), showcasing expertise in business analysis best practices.

title: Business Analyst
description: Brooksource is hiring for an experienced P&C Underwriting Transformation Business Analyst. This position is responsible for creating solution recommendations, gaining alignment, and executing the implementation of the decision engaging multiple areas of the organization. This position works closely with all levels of the organization from c-suite to front line and within multiple areas of the organization including but not limited to:Operations, multiple underwriting business units, actuarial, product, IT, and Business Intelligence. Some of the key areas this role will be responsible for will be operational workflow for all Underwriting processes regardless of role as well as helping to execute key business strategies as it relates to people, process, technology, product, pricing, etc. In addition, this person will work closely with business and operations to understand current and determine the future state business process. The ideal candidate will have at least four years of underwriting transformation experience as a business analyst. Responsibilities: Understands current state business processes and be able to analyze, recommend, and influence future state processes taking into consideration people, process, and technology. Gracefully challenge the current way of thinking even when it isn’t popular. Train internal and external parties within person class sizes ~30 people and virtual class sizes 200+ Apply change management principles to successfully implement small to complex changes throughout the IAT organization. Work within a highly collaborative team environment. Responsible for understanding of the end-to-end Underwriting process from clearance through subsequent transactions and renewals based on prior experience. Responsible for defining and influence key data points for metrics to help drive process and technical requirements as well as reporting / metrics during implementation and continuous improvement phases. Responsible for understanding technical solutions as well as manual process solutions to be able to solve complex business problems. Drives business process definition and documentation of Business Process Flows. Works with the business to drive process improvement opportunities. Provides superior customer service to both internal and external customers. Actively and collaboratively drives business engagement and group sessions. Perform other tasks as needed. Qualifications: Must Have: Bachelor’s 4+ Years of P&C Underwriting experience required (preferably leading operations and/or acting in a business transformation consultant role) or equivalent experience. Equivalent experience is defined as eight or more years. Advanced knowledge of business problems and identifying solutions. Proven ability to adjust to changes within business strategy and/or project approach often. Proven strong analytical skills, especially with spreadsheets, Sharepoint, MS PowerPoint presentations, word processing, and visual business process tools such as MS Visio. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Demonstrates excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrates an aptitude to quickly learn business processes. Ability to multi-task, manage details, and execute effective follow-through. Proven advanced analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving abilities. Ability to display a continued commitment to expanding knowledge base through personal initiative and industry-sponsored courses/seminars. Ability to continue education and stay up-to-date on technical developments. Ability to perform effectively under tight timeframes with high standards, and bring about effective action through direction, example, and a collaborative team atmosphere. To qualify, all applicants must be authorized to work in the United States and must not require, now or in the future, VISA sponsorship for employment purposes. Preferred to Have: Six Sigma/ Lean Prosci Change Management PMP What’s in it for you? Get your foot in the door with one of the most respected and fastest growing companies in the United States! Brooksource offers competitive Health & Dental Benefit plans, Weekly Pay Checks while on contract, 6 paid Holidays, and 401K Eligibility. title: Business Analyst
description: Company Summary: We are a value-based, precision medicine company specializing in solutions for providers, patients, life science and EMS companies. With the emergence of value-based care, Integra Connect’s mission is to help specialty care providers succeed both clinically and financially. We accomplish this through a comprehensive offering of technology and services, unified by our cloud-based platform, combined with unmatched industry expertise. We are looking for like-minded individuals committed to making a difference in healthcare. Come join our growing team! Job Description: The Business Analyst supports the Chief Data Officer (CDO) team and will help optimize/enhance the organization’s data governance, data science, and data management functions. More specifically, the Business Analyst’s role will be to help streamline data flows, maximize usability, support internal/external customer needs, and address data quality issues. Responsibilities: Perform data analysis and present findings/insights in an accurate, clear, and concise manner. Actively participate in the design, documentation, execution, implementation, and presentation of analytic deliverables. Lead and manage multiple large and complex projects concurrently using formal project planning techniques. Collaborate with stakeholders/clients to define project objectives and goals, scope, approach, resource requirements, and risks and communications strategy; align business processes across multiple stakeholder groups; and facilitate the creation and execution of project plans. Author and update internal and external documentation; formally deliver requirements and detailed documentation. Respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations. Provide guidance to the team on performance/productivity issues, assist clients with solving critical issues, and identify innovative solutions to resolve complex problems. Assist, guide, and improve data management and data modeling activities. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications: 3+ years of related business and analytical experience. 2+ years of healthcare experience involving clinical systems (such as EHR) and claims data (such as EDI). Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, or Business, or equivalent work experience. Strong written and verbal communications, including ability to summarize the results of data analysis for technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to communicate analytic results and business requirements via in person meetings, web conferences, and technical/non-technical documents to cross-functional audiences. Ability to work independently and demonstrate initiative and problem-solving skills within a fast-paced, ever-changing, start-up environment. Extensive experience and proficiency leveraging SQL, including loading data, joining tables, as well as writing update and select statements. Experience with Excel spreadsheets and other office productivity applications to share and present analytic results. Excellent project management skills. Experience with modern relational databases, database management, and data modeling. Experience with data modeling tools such as ERWin is preferred. Experience with business intelligence tools such as Power BI and Tableau is preferred. Experience with statistical analysis tools such as SAS, Python, and R is preferred. Benefits: Integra Connect, LLC provides a comprehensive benefits plan. Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance beginning the 1st of the month following your date of hire Paid Time Off 401k with employer match Paid Holidays and Floating Holiday Equal Opportunity Employer Please note that the deadline for submitting applications is July 4, 2024. All applications must be received by this date to be considered. Important Notice: At Integra Connect, we are committed to providing a safe and secure environment for our job applicants. Unfortunately, scammers may attempt to impersonate our company to deceive individuals seeking employment. We take this matter seriously and want to ensure your job search with us is free from any fraudulent activity. Integra Connect has become aware of recent, fraudulent recruitment activity being conducted by individuals or groups who claim to be third party recruiters and/or points of contact for our Company. Examples include sending candidates a request for personal information, conducting online interviews or meetings, making offers of employment, demanding money for employment related services and activities, or asking the applicant to purchase a laptop or other work-related equipment for the job. The aim of the fraud is to obtain personally identifying information ( e.g ., identity theft) and/or money. The Company’s name, as well as the names of employees, are used to try to convey authenticity. Here are some tips to help you identify and avoid job scams: 1. Always Check the Source: Ensure that the job listing is on our official website or a reputable job board. Our official domain is https://www.integraconnect.com/resources/careers/. Be cautious of unsolicited emails, text messages, or social media messages offering job opportunities. 2. Be Wary of Requests for Personal Information: We will never request sensitive personal information like your Social Security number, bank details, or payment for onboarding/equipment. If you encounter such requests, it’s likely a scam. 3. Verify Contact Information: Check that the contact information provided in the job posting, including email addresses and phone numbers, aligns with our official contact information. Scammers often use generic or non-company email addresses. What is the sender’s email address? Is it consistent with other job postings from this company? Email addresses that are slightly different from any business’s primary contact information (Jane.Doe@IntegraConnect.org vs John.Doe@Integra Connect.com) are a common warning sign. If you are contacted through LinkedIn, be sure to review the entire profile to verify their credentials. If you suspect that a job offer is fraudulent, we recommend that you do not respond to it. If you believe you are the victim of any fraudulent activity, you can report it to the appropriate authorities at https://www.myfloridalegal.com/consumer-protection/how-to-protect-yourself-job-listing-and-job-search-firms (Florida Department of State) and/or https://consumer.ftc.gov/articles/job-scams#report (U.S. Federal Trade Commission). Integra Connect is not responsible for any fraudulent offers and advises prospective candidates to follow the guidance provided above. Thank you for your interest in a career with Integra Connect. We look forward to connecting with genuine, talented individuals like you.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Description We are seeking a proactive and analytical Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. The Business Analyst will play a key role in analyzing business processes, identifying opportunities for improvement, and implementing solutions to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness. This role requires strong analytical skills, business acumen, and the ability to collaborate with stakeholders across different departments. Roles And Responsibilities Business Process Analysis: Evaluate current business processes, workflows, and systems to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement. Conduct interviews, workshops, and surveys to gather business requirements and understand stakeholder needs. Data Analysis and Interpretation: Collect, analyze, and interpret data from multiple sources to provide insights and support decision-making. Develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present findings to stakeholders. Requirements Gathering and Documentation: Collaborate with stakeholders to define and document business requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria. Translate business requirements into functional specifications and technical solutions. Solution Design and Implementation: Work closely with IT teams to design and implement technology solutions that address business needs and objectives. Participate in the development and testing of new systems, features, and enhancements. Project Management and Coordination: Manage projects from initiation to completion, including planning, scheduling, and monitoring progress. Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure project milestones are achieved within scope, timeline, and budget. Business Intelligence and Reporting: Develop and maintain business intelligence tools and systems for performance monitoring and reporting. Analyze trends, patterns, and metrics to provide actionable insights and recommendations. Change Management and Stakeholder Engagement: Facilitate change management processes by communicating project updates, training users, and managing resistance. Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders to foster collaboration and support project objectives. Continuous Improvement and Innovation: Identify opportunities for process optimization, automation, and innovation to drive operational efficiencies. Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies relevant to business analysis and project management. Skills And Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, Finance, or related field; Master's degree or certification (e.g., CBAP) is a plus. X+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role, preferably in a corporate environment. Proficiency in business analysis techniques, including process modeling, requirements elicitation, and solution assessment. Strong analytical skills with experience in data analysis, SQL querying, and reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau). Knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum) and tools (e.g., JIRA, MS Project). Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to effectively interact with diverse stakeholders. Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment. Problem-solving mindset with a focus on delivering practical and innovative solutions. Compensation The salary for this position is competitive and commensurate with experience. Benefits package includes health insurance, retirement plan options, paid time off, and professional development opportunities. Application Process Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your qualifications and interest in this position. We will contact selected candidates for further interviews. This job description aims to attract qualified candidates for a Business Analyst position by outlining specific responsibilities, required skills, and offering details about compensation and benefits. Adjustments can be made based on the company's industry, size, and specific business analysis needs, such as specialization in particular domains (e.g., IT, finance, healthcare) or business functions (e.g., process improvement, systems integration).

Creates and Distributes for Review Creates solution requirements and distributes working drafts for review and final team approval. • Creates training materials, including User Guides, Troubleshooting Guides, Install Guides, and Helpdesk 1st and 2nd level Technical Support Guides. • Creates Service Level Agreement and maintains changes to SLA documents. Day-to-day tasks of the Security and Compliance Business Analyst/Engagement Consultant - Intermediate include: • Independently completes project assigned activities, and initiates project/program tasks to meet work plan milestone dates. • Nurture relationships with clients and project managers so that issues can be addressed proactively and in a positive manner. title: Business Analyst
description: Company Overview: Mitsui Sumitomo Marine Management U.S.A., Inc. is one of the world’s top ten property/casualty insurance carriers with over 40,000 employees worldwide. Position Overview: The Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing, documenting and testing Insurance System Applications and providing technical support to the business users of those applications. Proactively works with the Information Technology Team Leads and Business Community in the planning and execution of all activities required to ensure that applications, interfaces, code environments, and functions remain highly available and up-to-date for both maintenance and business prioritized enhancements. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Demonstrate sound understanding of P&C processes and lifecycles. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user requirements. Ability to work directly with business client to understand business requests and interpret requests into business requirements and technical specifications. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs. Reviews and edits requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solution. Develops testing scenarios and expected results relative to specific software specifications and development. Performs regression, unit, and system software testing per test plans. Communicates issues and verifies issue resolution. Develops and communicates workarounds to business processes and system problems. Provides continuous progress and status reporting to project management. Assists in assembling test team members from functional areas as needed for user acceptance testing. Creates application documentation to assist in the support and training of users. Maintains clear, appropriate documentation for activities.. Effectively applies company methodology and enforces project standards. Reviews business and technical deliverables. Ensures that assigned issues are driven to conclusion. Performs other duties as assigned. Education and/or Experience Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience required. Specific knowledge of P&C Insurance systems and environment, with emphasis on policy administration systems such as Insurity Policy Decisions Guidewire PolicyCenter experience required. 5+ years P&C insurance experience required. IT project experience is required. 3 years of related experience in support or application development preferred. Business Analysis or Software Testing Certification preferred. Minimum of 5 years as an analyst covering multiple applications. Possess general understanding in the areas of application programming, integration, database and system design. Strong analytical and critical thinking; has the ability to think outside of the box. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present to groups on complex topics. Capable of multi-tasking and working well in a team environment as well as independently. Up to 20% travel may be required to other office locations for meetings, seminars, and training If you would like to apply for this position please send your resume to resumes@msigusa.com The Company is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Clinical Business Analyst
description: Title: Business Analyst (Clinical Operations & Informatics) We are excited to be expanding our Clinical Business Analysts group. We are looking for Business Analysts who have a passion for delivering solutions to scientists and healthcare professionals. Successful Business Analysts will enjoy working closely with cross functional teams of scientists, clinicians, and technologists to understand their needs. They will have a talent for understanding complex problems. They will also be comfortable working in an intense, fast-paced environment. As part of Arrayo’s Business Analysts team, you will be responsible for stakeholder management, requirements gathering, and providing visibility to upper management and other relevant project stakeholders. Responsibilities: Definition of process maps and optimized approaches to fulfil user requirements. Write systemdevelopment-related documentation (userrequirements and associated use cases, test protocols, migration requirements, user manual, etc.) Analyze clinical processes, data flows and data needs to identify solution opportunities, enhancements, data mapping and integration needs. Ensure adequate communication to stakeholders and sponsors: Work closely with product owners, development teams and users to interpret solution demand, refine user requirements/stories and prioritize backlog tasks. Liaise with technicalstakeholders to organizeall development phases (sprints definition, demo, testing phase, migration, validation, go-live, etc.) Work closely with project leads and other key stakeholders to Identify and manage risks and issues associated with collected demands, report on progress and outcomes. Participate in required meetings to communicate status, outcomes. Ensure regular and efficient follow-up and escalation of actions, decisions, risks and issues. Ensure compliance with industry processes and regulations Take active part (Business Analyst in an Agile product squad) to products deployment, improvement and/or roll- out that support the business processes Liaise with end-users: Support and contribute significantly to change management activities: accompany the users through changes on their processes Understand and becomes expert in the processes supported by thesystems Lead exploratory workshops w/ different techniques (e.g. storymapping, wireframing, etc.) Collect, formalize, challenge and endorse business requirements (in the form of user stories and acceptance criteria) Present demos Organize and lead testing sessions Draft User acceptance test scripts (UAT), review and dry run with the business team. Design and write test cases and validation protocols Execute GxP validation Perform deep and intensiveexploratory testing of the solutionas well as formal validation Contribute to the team Agile transformation: process, ways of working set-up,tools, etc. Qualifications: Well-practiced clinical development business analysts with strong skills in user requirements elicitation and process definition for application in technology solutions. Interpersonal skills and eagerness to build relationships proactively within global organizations Ability to understand lab technicians, and able to provide users support on lab software. Strong understanding of R&D clinical processes and data, knowledgeable of data management practices. Familiar with industry regulations and best practices. Skilled at conveying intricate technological matters to audiences with different levels of technical expertise. Excellent verbal and written communication skills 4 - 6 years of experience working as a Business Analyst in the life sciences/pharmaceutical industries and familiarity with pharmaceutical R&D technologies, tools, and methodologies Excellent analytical skills and proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally with stakeholders to capture value driven requirements and translate to solution outcomes. Familiar with agile and data management processes. Experience as analyst, leading requirements gathering, analysis, documentation Knowledgeable of industry standards and best practices, with a problem-solving mindset.

title: Business Analyst
description: Our Company About Us: American Integrity Insurance, a premier writer of homeowners insurance, has more than 280,000 customers and is exclusively represented by more than 1,000 independent agents who specialize in this complex and ever-evolving market. We offer sound and comprehensive home and dwelling insurance to families throughout the Southeast. Comprised of more than 300 insurance professionals, most of whom work in our Tampa-area headquarters, we have been recognized as a Top Place to Work in Tampa by the Tampa Bay Times and a Best Places to Work in Insurance by Business Insurance magazine for the past ten years. We have also rated among the Top Workplaces in the USA by USA Today for the past four years. A Day in the Life: Who Says Insurance Can’t Be Fun? From company picnics to charity events, no one can ever say American Integrity Insurance doesn’t understand the importance of having fun, helping others and giving back. Our company culture is priceless, and we hold true to our six core values: integrity, commitment, teamwork, humility, passion and fun. As a team working to provide home insurance solutions to our policyholders, together we aim to achieve greater heights each day and celebrate each other's accomplishments along the way. It is our mission to continue providing reliable, customer-centric homeowners insurance to Florida residents and paying claims in a timely manner when our customers suffer a loss – and to do so with Integrity. Learn more about American Integrity Insurance and our job opportunities at https://careers.americanintegrityinsurance.com. What You'll Do Elicits requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirement workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis and workflow analysis. Plans, designs and recommends business processes to improve and support business activities. Assists in the development of test plans/test scenarios and provide support during business application testing to verify requirements and business needs are fully implemented. Interprets stakeholder business needs and translates them into application (functional and non-functional) and operational requirements that improves the organization’s operating efficiencies and costs. Actively participates and supporst the delivery of business capabilities within an Agile framework (such as documenting or helping document user stories, acceptance criteria, root cause analysis, and provide effort estimates). Partners with stakeholders to gather and document requirements and explore potential solutions in collaboration with Developers and QA team members – can offer workarounds where determined. Tracks outstanding issues, effort estimates, implementation timelines and works with project delivery managers and release management team to plan implementation target dates. Interacts professionally and carries a positive attitude with a diverse group of executives, managers, subject matter experts, end-users and agents. Contributes to the overall growth and maturity of the Business Analysis function within the IT organization by engaging in collaborative and constructive discussions What You'll Need To Be a Top Candidate Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience: 2-3 years of experience in Property and Casualty Insurance experience required. Preferred candidate will possess 3-5 years of experience in a BA role or similar function. Knowledge: Advanced user – Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft PowerPoint. Knowledge of Microsoft Visio, SQL querying and policy and claims administration software required. Experience in technical, business and process documentation required. Experience in communicating with varied organizational tiers. Skills: Experience in technical, business and process documentation required. Experience in communicating with varied organizational tiers. Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills. Presentation skills including delivery to varied organizational tiers. Ability to successfully collaborate in a team environment with multiple team members. Flexibility to work in a fast-paced, priority-shifting environment.

title: Dept Specialist Business Analyst (Entry Level)
description: About The Company Albertsons Companies is at the forefront of the revolution in retail. With a fixation on raising the bar with innovation and building belonging through our culture, our team is rallying our company around a unique purpose : to create joy around each table and inspire a healthier tomorrow for every community. Albertsons Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers in the United States, with over 2,200 stores in 34 states and the District of Columbia. Our well-known banners include Albertsons, Safeway, Vons, Jewel-Osco, Shaw's, Acme, Tom Thumb, Randalls, United Supermarkets, Pavilions, Star Market, Haggen, Carrs, Kings Food Markets, and Balducci's Food Lovers Market. We support our stores with 22 distribution centers and 19 manufacturing plants. Placing a premium on adaptability, safety and family well-being, our work model, Presence with a Purpose, offers a hybrid work environment between remote work and office time. A one-size-fits-all approach does not apply to everyone, and teams are empowered to make decisions best for them. Bring your flavor Building the future of food and well-being starts with you. Join our team and bring your best self to the table. #bringyourflavor What You Will Be Doing Join our fast-paced teamwork atmosphere to support 2200 retail grocery locations in keeping repair work orders flowing properly to ensure equipment is up and running. Build valuable relationships and communicate with Service Providers, Division Maintenance Staff, Store Directors, and Senior Management. As a Department Specialist III/Business Analyst, you will be responsible for enabling the Albertsons Companies to receive the best possible service for all Service Requests ($400M) in our stores through our CMMS program, Corrigo. Maintain and update all maintenance activities related to repairs for assigned Service Pros (2500+). In addition but not limited to, report building, providing data analysis, Power BI, Google Cloud, Automations and more. This is a hybrid position currently in office Tuesdays and Wednesdays based in our Phoenix AZ office. (Office Days subject to change based on Corporate Determination) Main Responsibilities Assist Manager with maintaining our computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) to ensure accuracy and dependability. Provide End-to-End Testing and feedback for Corrigo upgrades, integrations, and automations. Collaborate closely with Manager and Divisions to establish MRO guidelines for all stores, setup, and support service networks for existing and new requirements. Assist secondary User groups (ACAMS, NASC, Food Safety, Corp Facilities) to use the system to full advantage for their business. Seek out and develop programs, system enhancements and training materials for All Customers – Retail Stores, Division Maintenance, MAPS and National Accounts Teams, other ABS Stakeholders as well as Service Pro network. Collaborate with Corporate Training to prepare and conduct training for User groups as required, either online or in-person. Prepare and conduct training for User groups as required, either online or in-person. Produce Company-wide ad-hoc communications as required for new assets and workflows. Assist Divisions and secondary User groups with PowerBI, Snowflake and Google Cloud Collects data/information for department use in special projects or reports. Assist Manager with Payroll responsibilities. What We Are Searching For Experience with Corrigo or other CMMS (computerized maintenance management systems) Strong data analytics Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong organizational skills. Friendly and positive attitude. Proficiency with MS Office applications. Ability to prioritize work assignments with excellent attention to detail. Ability to handle multiple demands and respond to urgent requests for information. Honest and trustworthy with the ability to work with confidential information. High school diploma or equivalent. What is it like at Albertsons? Our 290,000 associates have a passion for great service and building lasting relationships with our customers. Through a companywide focus on innovation, we are continually enhancing our digital and product offerings, making it easy for customers to get what they need, wherever they are. Albertsons is an Equal Opportunity Employer This Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, or on any other basis prohibited by law. Consistent with applicable state and local law, the Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. We endeavor to make this site accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at 1-888-255-2269(option #4).

Knowledge of Agile\SCRUM methodologies. title: Business Analyst
description: Job Overview: As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing an organization and designing its processes and systems, assessing the business model and its integration with technology. Your typical day will involve researching, gathering, and synthesizing information to assess the current state, identify customer requirements, and define the future state and/or business solution. Key Responsibilities : Develop and implement a comprehensive web analytics strategy aligned with business goals. Conduct business requirements analysis to identify customer needs and define the future state and/or business solution. description: Job Title: Business Analyst - Mid Level (Remote) Location: Raleigh, NC Duration: 12+ Months Job Description: The client is seeking a Business Analyst (BA) with Medicaid policy, client eligibility and/or Health and Human Services experience to join the Advance Planning Office. The primary role and responsibility of the BA is to work alongside the Budget Manager and APD Manager to provide support in the development of APD budget and documentation. The BA will collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, project teams, technical teams, vendors, contract and budget offices, and other key stakeholders to develop APD budgets required by Centers of Medicaid and Medicare Services (CMS). The BA must be able to take complex concepts and convert them into easily understood written documentation such that the content ensures successful system certification and compliance consistent with program management guidelines and processes and CMS expectations. Essential Responsibilities: Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, objectives, and challenges. Coordinate and meet with various teams, suppliers legal, and key stakeholders to support the gathering, analysis, and finalization of information to obtain final sign-off for the Medicaid Detailed Budget Summary Tables (MDBT). Work alongside the DHB business units, Medicaid Enterprise System (MES) project teams, technology teams, and subject matter experts to gain an understanding of project and related requirements to develop an appropriate MDBTs. Facilitate the Medicaid Detail Budget Summary (MDBT)review meetings with key stakeholders. Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Present findings, recommendations, and project updates to various audiences. Collaborate with project managers to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables Utilize tools, templates, and developed methods to keep abreast of project activities across the program. Ability to exercise communication skills in both written and verbal means to take complex concepts and convert into easily understood written documentation. Organize material and complete writing assignments according to agency standards regarding order, clarity, conciseness, style, and terminology. Attend client meetings to stay informed of current activities in NC Medicaid. Skills: Skill Required / Desired Amount of Experience Prior state government/public sector experience with health and human services programs (such as Medicaid) Required 3 Years Proficient use of project collaboration and tracking tools (Microsoft Project Suite, MS Teams, Zoom, etc.) Required 5 Years Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills. Required 5 Years Demonstrated stakeholder engagement and collaboration experience. Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Lead by example Teamwork - Be cooperative and collaborative while maintaining a team-first mindset Customer-centric - Always focus on the client and their customers. See the world from their perspectives Quality - Maintain a sense of pride in the quality of your work and the collective work of the team Be a Leader - Empower yourself to make decisions and don't be paralyzed by fear of failure We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workforce. Our projects are with some of the world’s leading organizations and tackle some of their most challenging issues. Our teams use cutting edge management science and often work at the highest levels of our clients’ and partners’ organizations. Projects include designing new businesses to commercialize new alternative energy technologies, architecting decision support to help federal government make value-based investments, innovating new platforms for transforming B2B commerce, and informing national policy efforts on human capital strategy, eradicating poverty in distressed communities, and restoring confidence in American institutions. Analysts work with clients and partners, so this role requires client facing skills as well as the technical and other skills for the role. It is a blend of multidisciplinary requirements with a focus on data architecture and business intelligence for decision making and an opportunity to truly innovate using ProOrbis methods on multiple projects. Role and Responsibilities The Business Analyst will: •     Set-up financial, market and operational analyses •     Conduct research for both quantitative and qualitative analyses. •     Structure/design market maps and competitive analyses. •     Format tools and financial models including visual display of data. •     Structure operations and developing mapping for new product development. •     Assemble organizational asset portfolios such as physical facilities, equipment, brands, human capital, strategic partnerships, information technology and intellectual property in both table and visual arrays. •     Formulate organization analyses and documents to set up new enterprises and projects. The Analyst Role will require: ·      3-5 years’ experience using business intelligence tools for informing decisions. ·      3-5 years working with analytic tools for models for decision making. ·      3-5 years working with financial analysis and reporting for company valuations ·      3 years working as part of an extended team on  client projects and programs. ·      Four-year degree in business, finance, economics, operations management, data science or other applicable degree ·      Experience in consulting, investment banking, M&A, corporate development, business management or similar environment with external clients. ·      High degree of motivation, flexibility, and creativity with the ability to work effectively in a rapidly changing environment. ·      Complete command of the Microsoft® Office suite of applications ProOrbis Started as a small woman-owned business in 1998, ProOrbis has built a family of companies using a breakthrough strategic framework and methodology for valuation of investments in intangible assets (such as human capital, technology, brands, etc.) for use in a variety of capital allocation decisions. Our methods represent some of the most advanced management science used in the world today and have been applied by a wide range of major corporations and federal government agencies as well as non- profits and start-ups. We are now automating and scaling our compendium of tools and analytics in partnership with private sector and government institutions in apps, software, and business platforms designed to underpin the next generation of the global economy. We are currently structuring several new enterprises and we are looking for people who would like to do interesting and exciting work with minimal travel. This is hybrid work, mostly remote but you must be able to commute to our office or travel to  client location for planning, development, and delivery sessions.  You will work with a collaborative group of senior professionals and executives from ProOrbis as well as from our clients and partners as part of a cohesive project team. This is a hybrid/integration type of role, to bring business requirements for decisions to the data needed to make them. You must have front line consultative skills as well as the technical skills to execute client requirements. You must be able to develop the financial, operational, and other  analyses required for clients and new company valuations. All analysts are trained in ProOrbis methods as needed to perform their role. This is an active learning experience, and you will be expected to apply learning to work products quickly. You will be using all the required skills across several projects and assignments.  Skill versatility is highly valued as well as learning agility.  The work ins data (qualitative and quantitative) but all data is monetized, so finance, accounting, and other business skills can all be important to growing in the role. Be prepared for 3-4 interviews for cultural fit, current skill level assessment and ability to work with a cross disciplinary and highly cohesive team. Interviews will be highly personal and be prepared to present yourself to the executive team.

title: Business Analyst
description: Nation Safe Drivers has been in business for 60 years and offers the rare opportunity to earn ownership stocks! With a stellar reputation as an industry leader in the Automotive Industry and one of the finest places to work in South Florida, we are excited about expanding our team. Our beautiful State-of-the-Art Corporate Headquarters is located in the heart of Boca Raton's thriving business park district. Employees are valued at NSD and enjoy a fun corporate culture, a supportive leadership team and excellent benefits. NSD has an immediate need for Business Analyst. Responsibilities: Data Collection and Cleaning: Collect, clean, and preprocess large datasets from various sources to ensure data integrity and reliability. Data Analysis: Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and correlations that provide valuable insights into business performance and customer behavior. Data Visualization: Create interactive and visually appealing dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools to present findings and facilitate data-driven decision-making. Performance Monitoring: Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics to monitor and track business performance over time. Predictive Modeling: Build predictive models and algorithms to forecast future trends, identify risks, and opportunities for improvement. Collaboration: Collaborate with stakeholders from various departments, including marketing, sales, finance, and operations, to understand their data needs and deliver insights that support their objectives. Data Governance: Ensure compliance with data governance policies and procedures, including data privacy regulations and best practices for data security. Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization to enhance skills and drive innovation. Documentation: Document data analysis methodologies, assumptions, and findings to ensure transparency and reproducibility of results. Education and Work Experience: Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, or a related field. Proven experience as a data analyst or business analyst, with a strong focus on data manipulation, analysis, and visualization. Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R. Expertise in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms, including designing interactive dashboards and reports. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. Experience in Call Center reporting including platforms such as Twilio, Ring Central preferred Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity. Experience with data warehousing concepts and techniques is a plus. Knowledge of statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms is desirable. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, with a passion for continuous learning and professional development. What NSD can provide: Excellent Benefits: Health, Dental, Life, Vision and Disability Options as well as Paid Vacation Days, Sick Days, Holidays and PTO. Pet Insurance too! Competitive compensation and a family-friendly work schedule Excellent Corporate Culture: Social Events, Recognition Luncheons, Family Days, and Holiday Celebrations Long-standing reputation for promoting from within -- great opportunity for a promising career path ESOP - Employee Stock Ownership Plan **NSD maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing. title: Business Analyst
description: Installed Building Products (IBP) is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Business Analyst to lead the successful execution of projects. Are you ready to look at the bigger picture and instigate change? Installed Building Products is the premier installation contractor for insulation in residential and commercial buildings, with over 10,000 employees serving more than 220 locations nationwide. Our commitment to quality and dedication to providing unparalleled service every day is shared by every IBP employee, from our branches across the country to our regional offices, and from our corporate office in Columbus, Ohio. The Business Analyst (BA) will assess business processes, identify areas for improvement, and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and drive growth. They will gather business needs, work independently to support projects, and collaborate with the Project Manager and IT partners to ensure accurate project requirements translation. Roles & Responsibilities: Elicit current state processes and requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task, and workflow analysis. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and decompose high-level information into details. Create, analyze, and validate detailed functional and non-functional specifications, including but not limited to business processes, develop GAP analysis, create an inventory of data interfaces, inputs/outputs, develop demo and test scripts as per each individual project requires. Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans. Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Act as a liaison between business units, technology teams, and support teams. Report status and issues to the Project Manager. Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. Other duties as assigned. Some travel may be required (max 20%). Qualifications Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Finance, or a related field. A Master’s degree is a plus. Experience: Minimum of 3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role. Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, Excel, and BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). Experience with process modeling tools (e.g., Visio). Software Knowledge: Familiarity with ERP systems (e.g., Acumatica, UKG) Experience in enterprise-wide projects Experience managing multiple projects with multiple clients Ability to research, formulate, and implement solutions where required. Proficient in MS Office Certifications: Professional certifications such as CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional) or PMP (Project Management Professional) are a plus. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex processes and draw actionable insights. Organization and Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Attention to Detail: High level of attention to detail and accuracy in all aspects of work. Interpersonal Skills: Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with stakeholders at all levels. Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing business needs and work in an atmosphere of ambiguity. Deliverables: Business Requirements constitute a specification of what the business wants. This is usually expressed in terms of broad outcomes the business requires, rather than specific functions the system may perform. Specific design elements are usually outside the scope of this document, although design standards may be referenced. Functional Requirements describe what the system, process, or product/service must do to fulfill the business requirements. Note that the business requirements can often be split sub-business requirements and many functional requirements. These are also called System Requirements. Non-Functional Requirements are requirements that cannot be met by a specific function e.g. performance, scalability, security, and usability requirements. These are often included within the system requirements where applicable. Report Specifications are reporting requirements such as the purpose of the report, justification of the report, report attributes and columns, or runtime parameters. Data Analysis : Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions. Process Improvement : Evaluate existing business processes, identify inefficiencies, and propose and implement improvements to optimize performance. Stakeholder Engagement : Facilitate meetings and workshops with stakeholders to gather requirements, present findings, and obtain feedback. Documentation : Create and maintain detailed documentation of business processes, requirements, specifications, and changes. Quality Assurance : Conduct testing and validation of solutions to ensure they meet the specified requirements and achieve desired outcomes. Training : Provide training and support to end-users to ensure successful adoption and utilization of new systems and processes. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Must be able to drive a car and lift light to moderate weight. EEO Statement IBP is an equal-opportunity employer.

title: Senior Analyst - Corporate Strategy
description: Senior Analyst - Corporate Strategy New York, NY, United States Full time Schedule $102,960 - $171,600 Annually* * based on job, location, and schedule JOB DESCRIPTION Bring Your Amazing Self to Work At Macy's, Inc. we're on a mission to create a brighter future with bold representation for all. This is our Mission Every One. We know that each person here is unique. So we respect and invest in each individual to create growth, pride, and satisfaction. If we are able to bring our whole selves to work, it translates into a more abundant and wider array of ideas and energy for all to benefit from. Our success will be built on amazing colleagues, working together. Job Overview The Senior Analyst tackles the most impactful challenges facing Macy's and the retail industry today, by pressure testing the status quo, challenging assumptions, and ultimately driving toward better outcomes through internal alignment. They are responsible for creating executive-level presentations, analyzing data, and strategizing and delivering solutions to internal Macy’s clients to promote growth and address the evolving needs of the business. Senior Analysts have the flexibility to explore various areas within Macy’s, Inc., serving as generalists on a variety of internal projects of strategic importance across the enterprise. They work on project teams of various sizes, leveraging guidance and support from senior managers and direct supervisors, and may also work independently depending on the scope, audience, and deliverable. What You Will Do Apply analytical rigor and creative problem-solving skills to address strategic business challenges. Evaluate new and innovative concepts and approaches. Acquire necessary subject matter expertise to become an informed partner. Synthesize key insights and develop actionable recommendations. Cultivate trusting relationships with key stakeholders across various functions. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop long-term strategies, establish strategic project management frameworks, and tackle complex challenges across different functions. Work collaboratively with other teams within the organization and with the broader Continuous Improvement team. Develop and deliver executive-level presentations. Demonstrate regular, dependable attendance and punctuality. Skills You Will Need Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to apply analytical rigor and creative problem-solving techniques to address strategic business challenges effectively. Innovative Thinking: Capacity to evaluate new and innovative concepts and approaches to drive improvements and better outcomes. Synthesis and Recommendation: Skill in synthesizing key insights from data and formulating actionable recommendations to drive business growth and address evolving needs. Stakeholder Relationship Management: Ability to cultivate trusting relationships with key stakeholders across various functions and levels within the organization. Collaboration: Proficiency in collaborating with internal stakeholders to develop long-term strategies, establish project management frameworks, and address complex challenges collaboratively. Executive-Level Communication: Strong presentation skills, including the ability to develop and deliver executive-level presentations tailored to different audiences. Communication Skills: Proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel, including basic modeling, with Tableau skills considered a plus. Strong oral, written, and listening communication skills tailored to various audiences and project stakeholders. Reasoning Ability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, goal-oriented, and time-sensitive environment. A self-starter with a curious mindset who stays informed about market changes and new trends. Experience developing holistic strategies through structured, project-based approaches. Capacity to work independently with limited day-to-day guidance. Mathematical Skills: Strong proficiency in quantitative and analytical approaches, with experience working with financial models and analyzing large data sets considered advantageous. Other Skills: High-energy and passionate with a proven track record of delivering results. Executes with a "Teams Win" philosophy, fostering a positive and collaborative environment. Who You Are Dedicated to fulfilling ideals of diversity, inclusion, and respect that Macy’s aspires to achieve every day in every way. Candidates with a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field are encouraged to apply. Strong record of academics, extracurricular activity, professional accomplishment and leadership, as well as professional work experience 1-2 years’ work experience, preferably in management consulting or investment banking. Knowledge and interest in retail, technology, and innovation. Regularly required to sit, talk, hear; use hands/fingers to touch, handle, and feel. Occasionally required to move about the workplace and reach with hands and arms. Requires close vision. Able to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs. What We Can Offer You An inclusive, challenging, and refreshingly fun work environment Competitive pay and benefits rooted in principles of equity Performance incentives and annual merit review Merchandise discounts Health and Wellness Benefits across medical, dental, vision, and additional insurance Retirement Savings Plan with 401k match opportunity Employee Assistance Program (mental health counseling and legal/financial advice) Resources for continuous learning, career growth, and leadership development 8 paid holidays Paid Time Off (first year prorated depending on start date) Tuition reimbursement program Guild education benefit funds 100% of tuition, books, and fees in designated programs Colleague Resource Groups (CRGs) and give-back/volunteer opportunities Empowerment and autonomy to perform impactful work with tangible results About Macy’s Now is an exciting time for a Macy's career as we continue to focus on creating exciting and memorable experiences for every Macy's customer, whether their journey starts online or in the store. Our opportunities in Sales, Merchandise, Operations, Customer Service, Warehouse, Marketing, and other areas let you express your creativity and commitment to excellence, grow your career and make a difference to your Macy's colleagues and customers. Bring your creativity, energy, and ideas to the Macy's team – Apply Today! This job description is not all-inclusive. Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. CORP00 This position may be eligible for performance-based incentives/bonuses. Benefits include 401k, medical/vision/dental/life/disability insurance options, PTO accruals, Holidays, and more. Eligibility requirements may apply based on location, job level, classification, and length of employment. Click here to see details on benefits.
