description: Please go through the job description below and let me know if you or anyone who is looking for a good opportunity. Accuterm Functional Analyst Duration: 6+ months Contract Location: 100% Remote A functional analyst for Accuterm is responsible for various technical and analytical tasks to ensure the efficient operation and enhancement of software systems. Here’s a detailed job description for an Accuterm functional analyst role: Accuterm Functional Analyst Job Description Position Overview: The Accuterm Functional Analyst plays a crucial role in managing and optimizing the use of the Accuterm software within the organization. This role involves working closely with business stakeholders, IT teams, and other departments to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and implement solutions within accuterm to leverage the business processes and Accuterm platform. Key Responsibilities: 1. Business Analysis and Requirements Gathering: Work with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate these into detailed business requirements. Conduct thorough analysis of business processes and workflows to identify opportunities for improvement using Accuterm. Document business requirements, user stories, and functional specifications. 2. System Configuration and Management: Configure and maintain Accuterm applications to meet business requirements. Ensure the system is optimally set up and used, aligning with best practices and industry standards. Manage system upgrades, patches, and customizations in collaboration with the IT team. 3. Technical Support and Troubleshooting: Provide level 2/3 technical support for Accuterm-related issues. Troubleshoot and resolve system issues, working with the software vendor as necessary. Monitor system performance and implement necessary improvements to ensure optimal functionality. 4. Training and Documentation: Develop and deliver training materials and sessions for end-users to enhance their understanding and use of Accuterm. Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, including system configuration, user guides, and troubleshooting procedures. 5. Project Management: Lead and manage Accuterm-related projects, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business goals. Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project execution and user adoption. 6. Data Analysis and Reporting: Utilize Accuterm's reporting tools to generate and analyze reports, providing insights and recommendations to business stakeholders. Ensure data integrity and accuracy within the Accuterm system. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field. Proven experience as a Functional Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role, preferably with Accuterm or other terminal emulation software. Strong understanding of business processes and the ability to translate them into technical requirements. Proficiency in SQL and experience with database management. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels. Preferred Skills: Experience with project management methodologies. Familiarity with other software applications and tools used in conjunction with Accuterm. Certification in business analysis or project management. This role requires a proactive and analytical mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team to drive continuous improvement in the use of Accuterm software across the organization. Thanks, Hitesh Moolya hmoolya@prodwaresol.com

BEHAVIOUR COMPETENCIES Manages Complexity: Makes sense of complex high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems. For example looks at complex issues from multiple angles; explores issues to uncover underlying issues and root causes; sees the main consequences and implications of different options. Optimizes Work Processes: Knows the most effective and efficient processes to get things done with a focus on continuous improvement. For example uses metrics and benchmarks to monitor accuracy and quality. Takes steps to make methods productive and efficient. Promptly and effectively addresses process breakdowns. Ensures Accountability: Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments. For example accepts responsibility for own work both successes and failures. Handles fair share and does not make excuses for problems. Usually meets commitments to others. Plans and Aligns: Plans and prioritizes work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals. For example outlines clear plans that put actions in a logical sequence; conveys some time frames. Aligns own work with relevant workgroups. Takes some steps to reduce bottlenecks and speed up the work. Action Oriented: Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency high energy and enthusiasm. For example takes timely action on important or difficult issues. Identifies and pursues new opportunities that benefit the organization. Cultivates Innovation: Creates new and better ways for the organization to be successful. For example demonstrates openness to new ideas and ways of looking at things; suggests new and useful ideas or solutions. Learns innovative methods tools and technology and applies them to work tasks. title: Business Analyst IV
description: Greetings! Hope you are doing good!! My name is Roshni Verma. I came across your profile on our resume database and wanted to reach out regarding a Job opportunity. If interested please reply with your updated resume, contact details, and the best time to discuss the opportunity. Additional Job Information Title : 62357 (Business Analyst IV) Start Date : 04/08/2024 Location : Salem, OR, 97301 United States Work will require three days a week on-site. Job Description Individuals in this position have demonstrated experience in the standard concepts, practices, and deliverables related to Business Analysis in support of software development projects. Understands how to gather and document requirements. Has a working knowledge of the software development lifecycle. Works under limited supervision with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Some familiarity with the use of standard market Testing tools. Requires a bachelor's degree in area of specialty and at least 9 years or equivalent experience in the field or in a related area. Seeking a full-time Information Technology Business Analyst (BA) that has proven experience with providing technical systems analysis and requirements solicitation. The business analyst will assist and provide expertise to project managers to identify and deliver technology solutions, determine the technical and operational feasibility of their solutions. In this role the Business Analyst will solicit, understand, and document the customer's technical business requirements, processes and workflows developing both written and visual depictions of requirements and process flows. Additionally, the Business Analyst will lead the development and validation of the non-functional technical specifications that meet those requirements, serve as a subject matter expert to the developers building those functions, and work with the team to test the functionality to ensure it meets the business need. You will work closely with Project Managers, System Analysts, and Production Support Staff through each stage of implementations Project Management Lifecycle. The Business Analyst will partner effectively with all levels of the organization, lead others, drive results, proactively identify and resolve problems, and make challenging decisions. You will also be responsible for recommending and instituting business system analysis best practices, tools and methodologies towards standardization of deliverables and procedures. Key Responsibilities Requirements Gathering and Analysis: Solicit, understand, and document customer's technical business requirements, processes, and workflows. Conduct interviews, workshops, and stakeholder meetings to elicit and clarify requirements. Develop written and visual depictions of requirements and process flows using tools such as use cases, user stories, flowcharts, and diagrams. Solution Design and Validation: Lead the development and validation of non-functional technical specifications based on the gathered requirements. Collaborate with project managers and development teams to determine the technical and operational feasibility of proposed solutions. Ensure that the proposed solutions align with business objectives, architectural standards, and regulatory requirements. Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with project managers, system analysts, and production support staff throughout the project management lifecycle. Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, translating business needs into technical requirements and vice versa. Communicate effectively with all levels of the organization, presenting findings, recommendations, and project updates in a clear and concise manner. Testing and Quality Assurance: Work with the development team to test the functionality of implemented solutions and ensure that they meet the business needs and technical specifications. Identify and resolve any issues or discrepancies found during testing, collaborating with stakeholders and technical teams to implement corrective actions. Best Practices and Continuous Improvement: Recommend and institute business system analysis best practices, tools, and methodologies to standardize deliverables and procedures. Stay current with industry trends, technologies, and best practices in business analysis and project management. Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and drive initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of business analysis processes. Qualifications And Skills Proven experience as a Business Analyst in information technology projects, with a focus on technical systems analysis and requirements solicitation. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements and vice versa. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Familiarity with project management methodologies and lifecycle processes, such as Agile, Scrum, or Waterfall. Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC) principles and practices. Certifications such as Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Project Management Professional (PMP) are a plus. Best Regards, Roshni Verma | Sr. Sourcing Specialist Syntricate Technologies Inc. 📞 Phone: (781) 532-8932 | 📧 Email: v.roshni@syntricatetechnologies.com

title: Business Analyst
description: We are seeking a Business Analyst for one of our clients, 7700 Midlothian Turnpike North Chesterfield,VA Please share the updated resume to venkat@dizercorp.com Job Title: Business Analyst Location: 7700 Midlothian Turnpike North Chesterfield, VA Duration: 12+ months Work Arrangement : Onsite Interview Type : In Person Only About The Role Virginia State Police (VSP) is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst with 6+years of experience to assist with the enhancement and support of sex offender management systems including the Virginia Sex Offender Management System (VSOMS) and VSOMS interfaces. The incumbent will assist VSP to replace paper-based processes with automated processes, and will create DocuSign eSignature forms and workflows that interface with VSOMS and other systems. The incumbent will perform complex business analysis and technical tasks such as project planning, process improvement, writing requirements, system design, data analysis, interface analysis, and system rollout. These duties involve the following: Leads the overall review, analysis and evaluation of current business systems; analyzes, recommends and implements process improvements; creates and evaluates user requirements and system needs; elicits requirements using various elicitation techniques such as Brainstorming, Data Mining, Document Analysis, and Interviews with users; produces requirements artifacts such as Field Definition Matrix, Business Rules, Interface requirements; performs gap analysis on existing requirements in conjunction with current business needs; contributes to and drives a collaborative effort to support organizational change management; facilitates risk analysis; participates in the creation and subsequent reviews of project test plans; leads all final user acceptance efforts with business stakeholders; defines roles and access rights needed for applications; represents VSP's interests with vendors and collaborates with them to help meet project needs; creates training materials and provides end-user training. Candidates for this position are required to have experience developing DocuSign eSignature forms and workflows, including experience customizing form behaviors using JavaScript. Also, candidates for this position should possess strong organization, administrative, analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills; be self-motivated and able to develop rapport and positive working relationships with coworkers and the agency at large; be proficient in Organizational Change Management; have prior experience implementing cloud-hosted Software As A Service (SaaS) solutions; have an understanding of business analysis concepts such as identifying and interpreting risk assessments; be able to produce requirement related artifacts such as test cases, requirements traceability matrix, business rules, interface requirements, use cases, activity diagrams, error validations and role based system profiles; be able to manage security access and user profile management; be able to work collaboratively with various groups within VSP and VSP vendors to ensure requirements are vetted and documented; be able to analyze functional/nonfunctional system requirements; be able to re-engineer business processes; be able to identify how new applications and business processes will integrate with or replace existing business processes; possess excellent communication skills in English and the ability to communicate with internal customers in nontechnical terms; be proficient with Microsoft Products (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint); be proficient in creating business and system requirements. Candidates should highlight any experience working on criminal justice projects. The incumbent must work full-time onsite at VSP headquarters, North Chesterfield. Regards, Venkatesh Simhadri Sr.Recruiter Direct: 216-452-9196 E-mail: venkat@dizercorp.com

title: Clinical Operations Business Analyst
description: Included Health is a new kind of healthcare company, delivering integrated virtual care and navigation. We’re on a mission to raise the standard of healthcare for everyone. We break down barriers to provide high-quality care for every person in every community — no matter where they are in their health journey or what type of care they need, from acute to chronic, behavioral to physical. We offer our members care guidance, advocacy, and access to personalized virtual and in-person care for everyday and urgent care, primary care, behavioral health, and specialty care. It’s all included. Position Overview The Clinical Operations Analyst role will amplify the impact of Included Health on the patients and members it serves by enhancing the current and future clinical offerings of the company. In close collaboration with Clinical leaders and our Data organization, this individual will produce the operational visibility necessary to drive product performance across our Virtual Care, Behavioral Health, and Navigation / Care Management programs. This position reports to the Director, Clinical Strategy and Operations, within Included Health’s clinical organization. The ideal candidate has a passion for advocating for data-informed processes and decision-making. You should have a background in analytics, report development, and telling stories with data. You should be able to spot opportunities to solve problems and answer questions with data. You should be comfortable taking ownership and have a desire to proactively collaborate with leadership. You will develop a deep understanding of how our business operates, and identify ways we can improve. This role is an individual contributor. Responsibilities Develop and own reporting and analyses that support business operations and clinical design Analyze and communicate insights on clinical service quality, outcomes, and efficiency Continuously monitor data and alert leadership and key stakeholders of trends that indicate issues, risks or opportunities for the business (including operational efficiencies, strategic changes, etc.) Provide insights to leadership and key internal stakeholders to improve the clinical operations provided to our members Monitor industry trends and maintain up-to-date expertise on reporting and advise organization and key stakeholders on best practices Create executive level data summary reports and present findings to leadership Meet data and reporting needs to support operational and quality improvement initiatives and monitor success Collaborate with Product Insights, Client Analytics, Data Science, and other analytics teams to ensure a consistent use of data objects and approach to data governance Produce data, reports, and/or analysis to support company and program accreditations Design data visualizations and dashboards to allow ongoing monitoring of quality of care and service Analyze information obtained from a variety of sources, conduct and document the thoughtful and sound analyses and evaluation of data, and provide meaningful interpretation of data to a variety of audiences Maintain current knowledge of relevant technologies as assigned Required Qualifications / Experience BA/BS in in epidemiology, social sciences, statistics, mathematics, computer science, information systems, or a related field; equivalent combination of education and/or work experience in related field may be substituted Experience developing data visualizations in Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI Expertise in Google Sheets and/or Microsoft Excel for data analysis Proficient in SQL with experience in writing complex queries Ability to contextualize and translate complex data analyses based upon the audience Knowledge of statistics or biostatistics and the appropriate application of analytic methods 5+ years expertise in manipulating and analyzing large datasets Ability to organize, delegate, coordinate, consolidate and prioritize multiple simultaneous tasks in a team environment Willingness and ability to provide mentoring, coaching, advice, and assistance to employees in a collaborative learning environment Excellent oral and written communications skills Excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills Preferred Qualifications / Experience Experience in analyzing healthcare-related data MA/MS in a related field 1 year of project management experience 1 year of product analytics experience Experience with Python, R, PostgreSQL, and/or MySQL Experience with GitHub, Salesforce, AWS, and/or relational databases The United States new hire base salary target ranges for this full-time position are: Zone A: $106,700 - $158,750 + equity + benefits Zone B: $88,900 - $132,250 + equity + benefits This range reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for candidates based on their respective Zone. title: Business Analyst
description: BASIC PURPOSE: Responsible for partnering with business units across the organization to understand and document capabilities needed to address business challenges. Work closely with Project Managers to review assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES: Document system requirements including integration between multiple systems, define scope and objectives, and assist in the creation of system specifications that drive system development and implementation. Evaluate user requests for system automation to determine feasibility and technical requirements. Facilitate meetings and workshops that involve eliciting business requirements and liaising with users. Work with business and IT Team members to map existing processes and design improved ones. Assess and analyze existing processes and data to identify improvement opportunities and present findings to stakeholders for discussion. Work with stakeholders throughout the entire life-cycle of projects to define, design, and implement software solutions. Serve as a liaison between Operations and IT to assist or gather business requirements needed for system modifications, enhancement and implementations. Identify improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive) Conduct cost benefit analysis and build business case to seek financial approval for solution implementation. Lead or participate in multiple projects by completing and updating project documentation; managing project scope; adjusting schedules when necessary; determining daily priorities; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; following proper escalation paths; and managing customer and supplier relationships. Create and maintain project schedules by developing project plans and specifications, estimating time and resources, monitoring milestone completion, tracking all phases of the project lifecycle, providing timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions and resolving conflicts. Meet with project team regularly to review project deliverables and deadlines. Develop and execute test plans. Manage and monitor buy-lists; Track REQs/POs to ensure timely delivery and follow-up to alleviate project risks. Perform other job-related tasks as needed. KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE: EDUCATION: Bachelor's Degree in information technology, business administration, hotel management or related field of study or any equivalent combination of experience and skills. EXPERIENCE: 3-5 years of experience in business process design or requirement, gathering and translating business requirements for development, using Agile and/or Waterfall methodologies experience. Travel or hospitality web/reservation system experience preferred. KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS: Understanding of applications such as Microsoft Suite, Clarity, Monday.com, LucidChart, JIRA, and project management tools). Ability to deal effectively with multiple priorities under tight deadlines by setting the appropriate expectations. Strong written and oral communication skills. Strong technical skills, and/or highly skilled user of reservations application used within the enterprise.

title: Business Analyst
description: Company Description A best-in-class city that attracts best-in-class talent, Philadelphia is an incredible place to build a career. From our thriving arts scene and rich history to our culture of passion and grit, there are countless reasons to love living and working here. With a workforce of over 30,000 people, and more than 1,000 different job categories, the City of Philadelphia offers boundless opportunities to make an impact. As an employer, the City of Philadelphia values inclusion, integrity, innovation, empowerment, and hard work above all else. We offer a vibrant work environment, comprehensive health care and benefits, and the experience you need to grow and excel. If you’re interested in working with a passionate team of people who care about the future of Philadelphia, start here. What we offer Impact - The work you do here matters to millions. Growth - Philadelphia is growing, why not grow with it? Diversity & Inclusion - Find a career in a place where everyone belongs. Benefits - We care about your well-being. Agency Description The Office of Director of Finance was created by the Philadelphia Home Rule Charter, adopted by the electors of the City on April 17, 1951, to give the Mayor and the City government a principal officer responsible for the financial, accounting, and budgeting functions of the executive branch. The Director of Finance is thus the chief financial officer of the City and all powers and duties concerning finances, accounting, and budgeting in the executive branch are directly or indirectly the Director's. The Director of Finance is also the Chairman of the Board of Pensions and Retirements and an ex-officio member of the board of various quasi-governmental agencies, including the Pennsylvania Intergovernmental Cooperation Authority. The City of Philadelphia operates on a fiscal year between July 1st and June 30th. Job Description Position Summary The Business Analyst reports to the OnePhilly HR Lead. This role is responsible for guiding the success of the technology and services related to various business processes that align with OnePhilly’s technological strategic priorities. Working with cross-functional teams within the OnePhilly environment and business process stakeholders, they will oversee HR and Benefits related business process initiatives from requirements through implementation, assessment, testing, and continuous enhancement. In this role, the Business Analyst will be the ‘voice of the customer,’ focusing on needs, expectations, understandings, and desires of the OnePhilly stakeholders to improve processes and increase satisfaction. As a member of the OnePhilly’s Team, the Business Analyst is expected to uphold the organization’s mission and contribute positively to a collaborative, human-centered, innovative, accountable, transparent, and inclusive culture within the OnePhilly Team. Essential Functions This role will be responsible for establishing testing standards, protocols and repository for all end-to-end HR Testing. Collaborate with Human Resources/Payroll/Benefits/and OnePhilly team to implement business requirements and system enhancements documents. Work with department users to understand their requirements and translate into system enhancements or defect fixes. Troubleshoot and resolve system issues while supporting day to day operations. Gain an in-depth understanding of OnePhilly’s processes and requirements. Help HR and Benefits modules leads in unit testing, data validation, and end to end testing if required. Maintain frequent and detailed communication with all members of the team to ensure alignment. Review and respond to SysAid Tickets for HR and Benefits Module. Strong knowledge of Excel, Word and Sharepoint. Perform other duties as assigned. Competencies, Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Demonstrated ability to think strategically about the application of technology to solve business problems and develop user/business-driven technology strategies and plans. Ability to work with end users to understand and analyze business processes, define requirements, and assess technologies to determine fit for client needs; and with technical staff to translate those requirements into appropriate technical specifications. Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical concepts and information to non-technical audiences in a compelling and empowering way. Deep commitment to developing and delivering modern, user-centered, and value-producing technology products, systems, and services in a collaborative way. Ability to build effective relationships and strong commitment to working collegially and collaboratively with constituents at all levels in a diverse and distributed environment. Qualifications We care more about what you can do than where you learned how to do it. That said, a bachelor’s degree is a good foundation for the work, and job-related experience around the competencies above is acceptable as well. The ideal candidate will have at least three years of experience with business analysis as well as working on and/or leading project teams. Additional Information TO APPLY: Please submit a resume, references, and cover letter. Salary range: $75,000 Discover the Perks of Being a City of Philadelphia Employee: Transportation: City employees get unlimited FREE public transportation all year long through SEPTA’s Key Advantage program. Employees can ride on SEPTA buses, subways, trolleys, and regional rail for their daily commute and more. Parental Benefits: The City offers its employees 6 weeks of paid parental leave. We offer Comprehensive health coverage for employees and their eligible dependents. Our wellness program offers eligibility into the discounted medical plan Employees receive paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays Generous retirement savings options are available Pay off your student loans faster - As a qualifying employer, City of Philadelphia employees are eligible to participate in the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program. Join the ranks of hundreds of employees who have already benefited from this program and achieved student loan forgiveness. Unlock Tuition Discounts and Scholarships - The City of Philadelphia has forged partnerships with over a dozen esteemed colleges and universities in the area, ensuring that our employees have access to a wide range of tuition discounts and scholarships. Experience savings of 10% to 40% on your educational expenses, extending not only to City employees but in some cases, spouse and dependents too! Join the City of Philadelphia team today and seize these incredible benefits designed to enhance your financial well-being and personal growth! The successful candidate must be a city of Philadelphia resident within six months of hire Effective May 22, 2023, vaccinations are no longer required for new employees that work in non-medical, non-emergency or patient facing positions with the City of Philadelphia. As a result, only employees in positions providing services that are patient-facing medical care (ex: Nurses, doctors, emergency medical personnel), must be fully vaccinated. title: Business Analyst
description: The Executive Office of Health and Human Services (EOHHS) provides services that directly touch the lives of slightly more than 1 in 4 residents in the Commonwealth. Some of our most vulnerable citizens, including children, youth, adults, and the elderly are served by The Executive Office of Health and Human Services. EOHHS is the largest secretariat in state government and is comprised of 12 agencies, in addition to 2 soldiers' homes and the MassHealth program. The Commonwealth of Massachusetts' Executive Office of Health and Human Services is currently seeking an exceptional individual to join the EHS IT team. This is an exciting opportunity to join a highly skilled team and contribute to critical and highly visible projects and processes within the Executive Office of Health and Human Services. The Medicaid Management t Information System (MMIS) seeks a Senior Business Analyst (BA) to support our initiatives support our initiatives. The BA will report to the MMIS acting PMO lead. Responsibilities will include gap analysis, gathering and documenting business/technical requirements, and systems documentation through the project life cycle, including discovery, design, development, testing, and implementation of projects and any enhancements to meet the project objectives. The BA should be well-versed in the systems development lifecycle and testing cycles. Preference will be given to candidates with prior experience with Medicaid systems, testing, and government experience. The BA must have sufficient knowledge of working in an Information Technology (IT) environment. Ensure the entire scope of work aligns with standard operational procedures and standard practices. The BA primary responsibility is to support the Senior PM to oversee delegated areas of responsibility, project vetting of documentation, validation of implemented coding through self-testing or coordination with testing team meets the requirements and conforms to all applicable Federal and state laws. Note – this position will be working on Hybrid schedule with an expected two days' work in the Quincy office location. Detailed List of Job Duties and Responsibilities: Candidates will be expected to demonstrate business and technical analytical skills. Lead and participate in joint application discovery, design, test sessions with stakeholders. Conduct and document data analysis and query, as well as gap analysis. Develop test strategies, test scenarios and test cases based on written requirements. Execute and review test runs and sign off on testing components. Document business, functional and systems requirements and participate in their development and testing. Provide oversight role, as required, during the stabilization phase of each migration including monitoring of system change execution, the development of system "fix” strategies and the close monitoring of the implementation of those strategies Communicate updates and changes to impacted stakeholders and project teams. Collaborate with technical and vendor teams to capture, track and vet requirements and create traceability from requirements to implementation. Collaborate, where required, to capture and change activities. Provide back up to support PM where required. Support MMIS portfolio dashboard development/enhancement Strong MS office skill including Excel, Power point, VISIO etc. Other responsibilities as required. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or higher in Business, IT or Healthcare administration with minimum 3 years' experience, or equivalent in healthcare administration setting , Strong business/systems analysis ability and problem-solving skills Some development skills preferred. Strong data analysis skills Excellent communication skills written and verbal; and presentation skills Great follow through skills Can work independently and as a team player

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Description: We are seeking a talented and motivated Business Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for detail, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering and analyzing business requirements, developing strategies to improve business processes and drive growth. Responsibilities: Gather, analyze, and document business requirements from stakeholders across various insurance lines (Auto, property etc.). Conduct process mapping, workflow analysis, and data modeling to optimize insurance operations (underwriting, claims, policy administration). Facilitate requirements elicitation sessions, workshops, and interviews with underwriters, claims handlers and other subject matter experts. Translate business requirements into functional specifications, user stories, and technical artifacts for insurance applications and systems. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (IT, developers, architects) to design and implement technology solutions aligning with business needs. Provide subject matter expertise on insurance products, processes, policies, and regulatory compliance during solution design and implementation. Validate solution designs against business requirements, industry regulations, and best practices in the insurance domain. Manage stakeholder expectations, fostering communication and collaboration between business and technical teams. Identify opportunities for process optimization, develop recommendations, and support implementation of improved insurance workflows. Continuously enhance domain knowledge by staying updated on insurance industry trends, regulations, and emerging technologies. Create detailed and accurate Visio diagrams to represent business processes, workflows, and systems. Prepare comprehensive documentation of business requirements, process flows, and functional specifications. Develop reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders. Identify opportunities for process improvement and recommend solutions. Writing clear and concise technical documentation, including user manuals, functional specifications, and system design documents is a plus. Experience using tools like BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation) is a plus. Familiarity with testing processes and methodologies to ensure that developed solutions meet business requirements. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Computer Science, or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in a technology-driven environment in insurance space. Proven track record of successfully delivering complex projects on time and within budget. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and propose innovative solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels. Solid understanding of business process modeling, requirements gathering, and documentation techniques. Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies and tools. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Professional certifications in business analysis (e.g., CBAP, CCBA) is preferred. Prior experience in the insurance sector is essential.

title: Business Analyst
description: JOB DESCRIPTION The data engineer/business analyst designs solutions that help the bank manage, secure, and generate value from its data. The person in this role creates scalable and reusable solutions for gathering, collecting, storing, processing, and serving data on both small and very large (i.e. Big Data) scales. These solutions can include on-premise and cloud-based data platforms, and solutions in any of the following domains ETL, business intelligence, analytics, persistence (relational, NoSQL, data lakes), search, messaging, data warehousing, stream processing, and machine learning. Responsible and accountable for risk by openly exchanging ideas and opinions, elevating concerns, and personally following policies and procedures as defined. Accountable for always doing the right thing for customers and colleagues, and ensures that actions and behaviors drive a positive customer experience. REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Information Systems or equivalent combination of education and experience. Strong communication skills- Must be able to communicate ideas both verbally and in writing to management, business and IT sponsors, and technical resources in language that is appropriate for each group. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills when resolving data related issues or designing new solutions Technical skills – SQL (3-5 years of experience), DataStage (ETL), DBT, Snowflake, Python Conceptual understanding of one or more of the following disciplines preferred big data technologies and distributions, metadata management products, commercial ETL tools, Data Visualization and reporting tools, data warehousing, SQL, data testing, major cloud, or rest API design and development. Experienced in SDLC and can assist in Project Management. Able to understand release management protocols and manage important tasks for implementation. Encore Talent Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce.

title: Project Business Analyst
description: Live Onsite (optional) in Cancun, Collaborate with Experts in Psychedelics, and Transform Lives as a Business Strategy Consultant at Beond Ibogaine! Beond Ibogaine is seeking a trained and experienced Business Strategy Analyst or Consultant to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, experience with strategy consulting, and an interest in psychedelic and/or holistic medicine. This role focuses on market sizing, new service line development, and strategic initiatives to drive growth and innovation. It includes working closely with team members to solve complex problems and deliver impactful solutions. Beond Ibogaine is thrilled to extend an invitation to a skilled Business Strategy Consultant to join our team in Cancun for a 2-6 week period (or workfully  remotely if preferred). This unique opportunity offers you the chance to immerse yourself in the transformative work we do (including access to participate in daily workshops, yoga classes, and regenerative options like ice baths!), collaborating with our dedicated team of board-certified doctors, ICU-certified nurses, and a diverse range of adjunct therapists. As a Business Strategy Consultant, you will play a pivotal role in our mission to develop strategies that achieve a sustainable advantage and performance optimization strategies. Your strong analytical background, experience in strategy consulting, and interest in psychedelic and/or holistic medicine will be essential in driving our strategic initiatives forward. This role focuses on market sizing, new service line development, and innovative growth strategies. During your time with us, you will work closely with the Beond leadership team, experiencing firsthand the impact of our work and contributing to our ongoing efforts to improve and expand our services. This is a unique opportunity to collaborate in a dynamic environment, gaining insights from our highly skilled medical and therapeutic professionals. We believe that your expertise and fresh perspective can greatly contribute to our strategic goals. Key Responsibilities: Market Research & Analysis Conduct thorough market research and analysis to inform business decisions and drive growth. Develop market sizing models and forecasts for current and proposed business models. Conduct feasibility studies and business case development for new services. Strategic Planning & Continued Analysis Apply a structured problem-solving framework to ensure consistency and clarity in complex projects. Develop and refine business strategies in collaboration with senior leadership. Focus on achieving tangible outcomes and delivering impactful results for Beond Ibogaine. Monitor and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) related to strategic initiatives. Project Ownership Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation and reports. Take ownership of projects and drive them to successful completion. Evaluate and develop new service lines aligning with our mission. Global Collaboration Work cross-functionally with clinical, marketing, and operational teams to launch new service lines. Leverage Beond Ibogaine’s global network to collaborate and access diverse expertise for us in strategic initiatives, including marketing content and new lines of business. Innovation and Thought Leadership Challenge traditional approaches and think creatively to drive innovation at Beond Ibogaine. Contribute to thought leadership initiatives and share insights with the broader team. Foster a collaborative and team-oriented work environment. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Finance, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred. 3-5 years of experience in strategy consulting, market analysis, or business development. Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with proficiency in financial modeling. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Strong project management skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively. Why Join Beond Ibogaine? Be part of a mission-driven organization dedicated to transformative healing and well-being. Opportunity to shape and drive strategic initiatives in an exciting and rapidly growing industry (psychedelics). Collaborative and supportive work environment with a focus on professional growth and development. Competitive compensation. Application Process: Submit your resume and cover letter to people@beond.us with the subject line “Business Analyst Application - [Your Name].” Beond Ibogaine is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Business Analyst
description: Bringing our love of food to families for five generations! Blount Fine Foods is a family-owned and operated manufacturer, marketer, and developer of premium fresh prepared foods. We are an engaging team, bringing restaurant-quality products to America including single-serve grab-n-go fresh soups, mac & cheese, and entrées in grocery stores across the country, as well as for hot bars and restaurants. Help us create the finest food experiences including those with specialty certifications that include organic, gluten-free, and low sodium, among others. Join a proven team for growth, success, and a satisfying career! Summary – We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Business Analyst to join our technology project management/digital transformation team. The primary focus of this role will be to analyze and document business processes, identify process gaps, gather requirements to address these gaps, and contribute to the overall efficiency and effectiveness of our operations. The successful candidate will work closely with various business stakeholders, manage small projects, and play a crucial role in enhancing our business processes. Essential Duties: Business Process Documentation Analyze and document current business processes within the food manufacturing environment. Create detailed process maps, workflow diagrams, and related documentation to provide a comprehensive understanding of existing procedures. Gap Analysis Identify gaps and inefficiencies in current business processes. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand pain points and areas for improvement. Requirements Gathering Work closely with business stakeholders to gather and document requirements for addressing process gaps. Ensure a thorough understanding of business needs and objectives. Training Requirements Identify training needs arising from process improvements or changes. Develop training materials and collaborate with the training team to facilitate smooth transitions. Test Planning and Execution Develop comprehensive test plans based on gathered requirements. Execute test plans, ensuring that changes meet specified requirements and do not negatively impact existing processes. Project Management Manage small projects as assigned, ensuring timely completion and adherence to project goals. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement process improvements. Stakeholder Interaction Regularly interact with business stakeholders to understand their needs and concerns. Facilitate workshops and meetings to gather input, present findings, and obtain approvals. Education and/or Experience: Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Information Technology, or related field. Proven experience as a Business Analyst in the food manufacturing industry. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with stakeholders. Project management experience, with the ability to manage small projects independently. Proficient in business process modeling tools and techniques. Familiarity with quality assurance and testing processes. Our Total Compensation Package Includes: Medical, dental and vision benefits. 401k with Company match. Paid time off including vacation, sick time, and holidays. Education Assistance Program. Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability. Discounts on Blount products at Company retail location. Discretionary Annual Bonus Program.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Remote -(Contract 18 months) Optomi Professional Services has collaborated with a prominent company in the Healthcare Insurance industry to seek out a Senior Business Analyst. The optimal candidate will contribute to various aspects of the business's growth through the examination of historical, present, and forthcoming business patterns. This person will devise tactics to attain specific goals and put these tactics into action. Collaboration with different internal business divisions will be a common practice to comprehend the obstacles encountered by these teams and offer remedies to address them. Responsibilities Elicit, analyze, document, and manage requirements for changes to business processes, policies, information, and information systems for larger and/or more complex business problems. Develop and elicit requirements for departmental and corporate projects that are more complex in nature as requested by internal/external customers; prepare business and functional requirements. Communicate and validate requirements with stakeholders and identified SMEs. Ensure creation of and adherence to requirements approach and management plan in alignment with an overall project plan. Collaborate with project teams to adhere to solution scope and create and maintain requirements traceability. Drive and execute business readiness activities including the communication plan to support changes to technology, processes, and people. Support training and conduct focused analysis to ensure the efficiency of project implementations and ensure desired results. Develop and maintain reporting tools for use in measuring business area performance against metrics/industry benchmarks and ensuring data integrity and systems stability in support of operations management. Ensure that data is accessible in a timely and precise manner, disseminate reports, and effectively communicate and elucidate findings to the relevant business sector. Collaborate with trainers to create training initiatives that specifically address areas of concern. Use and promote industry standard analysis techniques, such as data flow modeling, use-case analysis, workflow analysis, business process mapping, functional decomposition analysis and/or financial ROI modeling for larger and more complex initiatives. Independently create effective presentations for review by varied levels of leadership; thoroughly document all analysis assumptions, procedures, and results in a manner appropriate for both senior executive and management review. Proactively identify areas of potential business risk, on projects both within and outside of control, make recommendations related to mitigation, and escalate as necessary Build and support strong business vendor relationships by documenting business issues, determining project needs, and supporting training as needed. Provide oversight and regularly perform peer reviews for less experienced analysts. The primary information-gathering component is substantial - involving numerous virtual meetings through Teams. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or advanced degree ( where required ) 5+ years' of experience in related industry Strong written and verbal communication skills Healthcare insurance background If lacking a degree, 7+ years of experience in a related field Must be able to go into great detail over previous projects worked Ability to develop impactful presentations (EST timezone) *Must be in approved states to convert.* Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maryland, Michigan, Mississippi, Missouri, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Wisconsin, and Wyoming, North Carolina

title: Jr Business Analyst
description: Must Have: 2 years of as a Business Analyst, gathering requirements and defining user stories Experience within media industry or working with media/digital assets Strong understanding of processes and attention to detail Ability to triage, solve problems and make recommendations Experience gathering requirements and creating users stories utilizing tools like Jira Day to Day Insight Global is looking for a Junior Business Analyst for one of their large media and entertainment clients. This is a 1 year contract and is requiring to work 8:30am- 5:30pm Pacific Standard Time. This person will be working on a high priority project around the organization and consolidation of content workflows and media assets into a single sports platform. You will be joining a team of 4 other Business Analysts. The other Business Analysts will be focused on the heavy requirement gathering. While this person will be responsible for gathering some requirements, you will mostly be responsible for coordination, gathering information and presenting it in a succinct way and triaging/making recommendations on how to improve the process and ways in which these digital media assets, clips and programs are feeding into the platform. description: The Business Analyst is responsible for leading the implementation of business processes. This position will work on various projects including but not limited to the evaluation of current processes in order to maximize existing systems and business solutions, as well as the transition to new systems. Business Analyst acts as a key liaison with various cross functional partners to ensure that the business needs are being met on a daily basis as well as on a project to project basis. Key Accountabilities: Facilitates requirements gathering sessions to understand and document complex business needs, often eliciting hidden requirements and/or clarifying vague or unclear requirements. Analyzes business operations and processes to understand strengths and weaknesses. Supports the identification of opportunities for process improvement, management control of work, or automation. Creates requirements definition documentation and functional specifications to capture business needs using advanced business processes. Creates workflow diagrams to document current and future business environment. Validates with the customer and shares with project stakeholders. Applies thorough understanding of business processes and user needs to formulate and define system scope and objectives. Partner closely with the Director of IT to work through systems issues and to identify process improvements Tracks progress of projects to ensure alignment to requirements; manages any deviations from requirements to ensure resolution. Provides implementation support, preparing the business for the system solution. Acts as a subject matter expert and supports train-the-trainer and other learning activities with Corporate Learning and Development and Business Partners. Perform business process analysis and assist with the design and development/ improvement of new and existing SOP’s Support project plan for transforming organizations from current to future state with various departments Provide research to develop detailed, cross-functional business processes that standardize and streamline ways of working Prepare organizations for process change and actively support the change through day-to-day operations oversight and executive sponsorship management Review process adoption and adherence regularly by maintaining a pulse on the organizations and vendor community and effectively resolving roadblocks Administer user acceptance testing to obtain buy-in and sign off from stakeholders prior to implementation, includes external partners requiring access to applications Assist with the development of new testing methods in order to analyze the effectiveness of recently implemented processes Develop user documentation such as guides, training materials, etc. Assist in creating/editing training documentation Support end user training sessions and workshops Maintain communication with the business on project statuses and issue resolution Education and Experience: Bachelor's Degree preferred and 5-7 years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience with Product Lifecycle applications and systems a plus Experience constructing, implementing, and communicating new operational processes and procedures Previous experience with large-scale organization transformations and system implementations (Blue Cherry ERP system experience a plus) Experience in retail/apparel industry a plus PMP Certification highly desirable Skills: Solid understanding and use of Microsoft Office applications: Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio and BI systems Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to convey clear and concise thoughts and ideas Excellent time management skills including the ability to manage multiple projects at a given time Excellent analytical and research skills Ability to interact with all levels within the organization Ability to identify goals or requirements in user area that are conflicting with overall organizational goals, and raise them as appropriate Ability to clarify vague, undefined business needs, and determine how to best address them Ability to identify potential opportunities to automate and/or improve an existing process Ability to develop alternative solutions and provide recommendations for business case Can add value across multiple areas of the business.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Title: Senior Business Analyst Location: Jupiter, Florida Job-Type: Onsite (5 days per week) Employment Eligibility: Gravity can only consider US Citizens, Green Card Holders at this time Position Overview : The Nuclear IT Business Analyst plays a pivotal role in our organization, responsible for analyzing and optimizing business processes in the field of nuclear energy management. This role requires a deep understanding of nuclear energy management software systems and the ability to collaborate with the nuclear IT team to drive efficiency and effectiveness across operations. Responsibilities: Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and meticulously document business requirements to ensure a comprehensive understanding of needs. Software Solutions: Identify and implement software solutions that align with and support the optimization of nuclear energy management business processes. Functional Specifications: Develop detailed functional and technical specifications for software solutions, ensuring clarity and precision in implementation. Subject Matter Expertise: Act as a subject matter expert for nuclear energy management software systems, providing insights, guidance, and expertise to enhance system performance. Testing and UAT: Conduct system testing and facilitate user acceptance testing to ensure that software solutions meet established requirements. Risk Management: Identify and address risks and issues related to software systems, coordinating resolution efforts to maintain system integrity. User Training and Support: Provide training and ongoing support to end-users to ensure seamless adoption of new software solutions. Integration and Alignment: Collaborate with other IT departments to ensure the integration and alignment of business systems across the organization. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, business, or a related field. Experience: A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a business analyst role, with a focus on nuclear energy management software systems. Technical Skills: Strong knowledge and hands-on experience with nuclear energy management software systems. Proficiency in developing detailed functional and technical specifications. Organization and Time Management: Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively in a deadline-driven environment. Communication: Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal. Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team and build strong relationships with stakeholders across the organization.

title: Business Analyst
description: Job Title: Business Analyst Job Overview: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing business processes, gathering and documenting requirements, and facilitating effective communication between business stakeholders and the development team. The Business Analyst will play a crucial role in identifying opportunities for improvement, optimizing workflows, and ensuring that proposed solutions align with business goals. Key Responsibilities Requirement Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and document business needs and objectives. Conduct thorough analysis of current business processes to identify areas for improvement. Documentation: Create clear and comprehensive business requirement documents (BRDs) and functional requirement documents (FRDs). Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation throughout the project lifecycle. Analysis and Modeling: Use various analytical tools and techniques to model and analyze business processes. Translate business requirements into functional specifications and user stories. Communication: Facilitate communication between business stakeholders and the development team. Ensure that project objectives are clearly understood by all parties involved. Quality Assurance: Collaborate with the quality assurance team to develop test cases and validate that solutions meet business requirements. Change Management: Assist in the development and implementation of change management processes. Provide support during the transition from current state to future state. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or related field. Proven experience as a Business Analyst in a corporate setting. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Familiarity with project management methodologies. Proficiency in using business analysis tools and software. Additional Skills (Preferred) Knowledge of industry-specific regulations and compliance. Experience with data analysis and reporting tools. Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP) is a plus.

title: Business Analyst

This role will primarily focus on supporting our point-of-sale (POS) Magento-powered software solutions. Perform on-site visits to various stores as needed to validate system capabilities. Skills and Qualifications: 3+ years of experience in a mid to senior level business analyst or product owner role. Experience with point-of-sale systems, particularly in retail environments. Familiarity with Magento or similar e-commerce platforms is highly desirable. Proven ability to manage requirements development, system testing, and stakeholder consultations. Strong communication skills with the ability to represent the team professionally in both written and verbal interactions. Additional Requirements: Professional demeanor with a proactive and outgoing personality. Capability to manage stakeholder meetings and project updates via video conferencing tools. Contract-based employment, with potential for extension based on project needs. Ability to work effectively in a hybrid environment, with partial onsite presence in Plano, TX. Preferred Attributes: Prior experience in custom manufacturing environments or managing mixed product catalogs is beneficial. Understanding of multi-site networking implementations in retail settings. If you are a motivated professional with a background in business analysis and product management, and you thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply. Help shape the future of this company’s POS systems and deliver innovative solutions to our stakeholders. To apply or inquire further, please apply today! We’re moving quickly to fill this role!

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Location: Scottsdale, AZ Title: Sr. Business System Analyst Type of Position: Direct Hire Under minimal supervision, the Senior Business Systems Analyst assists in analyzing software requirements, procedures and problems to automate new or enhance existing software applications/systems. Essential Duties and Responsibilities : Collaborate with business partners to understand software needs and define requirements; translate requirements into technical solutions; provide recommendations and contingency plans. Document business requirements and capabilities into Business and Technical Design Documents, use cases and stories. Lead planning workshops/ design sessions to envision and assess business needs, features and desired capabilities. Capture, document and design business, application and data workflows. Collaborate with Quality Assurance (QA), developers/ engineers and architects to align solutions, identify dependencies, and ensure functional results. Conduct feasibility and impact analysis; identify cross-project, application or business unit dependencies; provide solutions to mitigate risk; develop contingency plans for potential impacts. Mentor Business Systems Analyst I and II. Stay current on the latest industry technologies, trends and strategies. Assist employees, vendors or other customers by answering questions related to IT Business Systems Analysis processes, procedures and services. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications: This position requires a minimum of five years of business analysis experience, including an advanced understanding of the software development life cycle, requirement modeling and process mapping techniques, operating systems (IOS, Android, Windows, etc), databases (DB2, SQL Server), non-relational file structures, system design, analysis, and development methodologies, and quality assurance testing methodologies. Experience preparing and/or executing business and technical requirements, specifications, user manuals, test plans, test scripts and test cases is also necessary. This position requires excellent communication, organizational, customer service and problem-solving skills. Ability to work independently and in a team is vital. Proven ability to work efficiently and accurately under pressure, meet deadlines and present a professional demeanor is essential. Proven ability to respond to different organizational situations while maintaining a positive and friendly attitude is necessary. Maintaining confidentiality, treating others with respect and upholding Company values are key attributes. In addition, organizational and problem-solving skills, a can-do attitude, and the ability to adjust to changing requirements are essential

title: Business Analyst
description: ERG is a research and consulting firm that provides a wide range of support to federal, state, and commercial clients. ERG offers multidisciplinary teams with nationally recognized skills in engineering, science, economics, public health, informational technology, and communications. We hire people with the best minds and then provide them with a vibrant and flexible environment in which to develop their careers. The qualified individual must be highly motivated with the skills to prioritize, perform, and communicate effectively in a fast-paced environment. Job Description Collaborate with team members and clients to support the development of web applications and data visualization tools Complete assigned tasks following an agile development framework, support development sprints, and use tools such as Jira and Confluence to track progress and maintain technical documentation Gather and document requirements and business processes to support product design and planning Create test plans and test cases Perform manual software testing and execute automated test cases Become familiar with socioeconomic and environmental datasets and federal environmental programs Analyze, summarize, and interpret environmental data and scientific results Actively participate in agile/scrum team ceremonies and status meetings with clients Qualifications And Skills BS/MS in information technology, health or environmental science, or related interdisciplinary majors or related fields (e.g., mathematics, science, engineering) Minimum GPA of 3.0 1 to 4 years of relevant experience Ability to pass a public trust-level background investigation as part of the credentialing process to work for our federal clients Ability to work independently to accomplish assigned work in a timely manner Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously to meet various project demands Demonstrates curiosity and embraces continuous learning, including proficiency in mastering new skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Familiar with an Agile software development approach Certified ScrumMaster or similar certification Experience with writing automated test cases using Selenium, SoapUI, or other software Experience with Qlik, Tableau, or other data visualization software $58,000 - title: BUSINESS ANALYST with CBAP and healthcare experience
description: Title: BUSINESS ANALYST with CBAP and healthcare experience Location: Remote We're looking for a Healthcare IT Business Analyst to join our remote team. As a Healthcare IT Business Analyst, you will collaborate with stakeholders in the healthcare sector to gather, document, and analyze business requirements for healthcare IT systems and applications. Key Responsibilities Collaborate with stakeholders in the healthcare sector to gather, document, and analyze business requirements for healthcare IT systems and applications. Utilize CBAP techniques to model current and future state business processes, identifying areas for improvement and optimization in healthcare workflows and operations. Create detailed use cases and user stories to capture functional requirements for healthcare software systems, ensuring alignment with stakeholder needs and industry standards. Conduct thorough analysis of healthcare data requirements, including data mapping, normalization, and transformation, to support interoperability and data exchange across healthcare systems. Ensure that healthcare IT solutions comply with relevant regulatory requirements and standards, such as HIPAA, HITECH, and HL7. Apply CBAP best practices and methodologies to drive successful healthcare IT projects from inception to implementation. Collaborate with IT teams and vendors to define integration requirements and protocols for healthcare systems, ensuring seamless interoperability and data exchange. Develop and execute test plans and scenarios to validate healthcare IT solutions, ensuring system functionality, accuracy, and compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Facilitate change management processes to support the adoption of new healthcare IT systems and workflows, including stakeholder engagement, training, and communication strategies. Coordinate with healthcare IT vendors and third-party service providers to evaluate, select, and implement solutions that meet the organization's healthcare business needs. Provide training and support to end-users to ensure effective utilization of healthcare IT systems and applications. Create and maintain comprehensive documentation to support effective communication and knowledge transfer within the organization. Identify and mitigate risks associated with healthcare IT projects to ensure successful project delivery and ongoing operations. Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies in healthcare IT, proactively identifying opportunities for process improvements and optimization of healthcare services and workflows.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Accela Business Analyst
